AD_HarpersPreparingBeforeAmbush.synopsis: A group of Harpers are standing outside an inn They had been preparing a dangerous ambush, but now the leader has another idea. The other Harpers are growing impatient.

Caravan_GoblinRanger_AtTower.synopsis: A goblin guard who reached Moonrise Towers with us. Currently idle as they await their new orders.

AD_HarpersMoveTowardsAmbush.synopsis: AD as a group of Harpers move through the shadow curse. They're moving at a quick pace, trying to speak quietly. The mood is tense.
AD_HarpersMoveTowardsAmbush.how_to_trigger: In Last Light, agree to help the Harpers ambush the drider. Follow them to the ambush site. As they move through the Shadowcurse, this AD should play.

PlayersAmbush.synopsis: The players have agreed to help the Harpers ambush a caravan of Absolute cultists and prisoners. You've just arrived at the ambush site - the mood is tense, words are spoken in harsh whispers. When the Caravan arrives there's a monsterous drider at its head, muttering to itself, talking to an imaginary queen/majesty that represents the voice of his God, The Absolute. The player can try to trick the drider into handing over its magic lantern (the Moonlantern - a glowing lantern hanging from the end of a staff), although that could leave the drider exposed to the worst effects of the curse. Will likely end in combat, either because you signaled the Harpers to spring their ambush or because the drider got suspicious and attacked.

HarpersAtInn.synopsis: The players encounter a squad of Harpers at the Last Light Inn who're preparing to set out on a dangerous mission to ambush a drider and some cultists in the shadow-cursed lands. Lassandra, a Harper scout that the player may have helped previously, might be there.
HarpersAtInn.how_to_trigger: After speaking with Jaheira, the Harpers should be in place outside the Inn, waiting for you. Speak to them to begin the quest.

PAD_TakeLanternAfterAmbush.synopsis: Players sided with the harpers and defeated the caravan after the ambush. They should now search the drider corpse for the lantern.

Caravan_AD_HalfOrcCaster.synopsis: Combat AD for Kanslf, Half Orc caster in the driders caravan
Caravan_AD_HalfOrcCaster.how_to_trigger: Get in to combat with the drider caravan

Caravan_AD_MeleeAndRangerGoblinsAtCheckp.synopsis: Two of the three goblins discussing at the checkpoint. The tracker is nervous, looking to chat to distract himself. Vez is absolutely uninterested.

AD_AfterTollhouse.synopsis: Kicks off conflict between two or more caravan members if they are all alive at the bridge next to the town, after the harpers' ambush.

ThanksAfterAmbush.synopsis: While following the caravan, together with the players are ambushed by a group of players. If they side with the drider after the combat resolves it will thank them.

Caravan_HalfOrcMelee.synopsis: Half-Orc at the edge of the shadow curse. Stoic and focused on the job.

AD_AfterAmbush.synopsis: Kicks off conflict between two or more caravan members if they are all alive at the bridge next to the town, after the harpers' ambush.

HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush.synopsis: Narrator nodes for the after ambush. Dialgo shared between Elindale, Manus and Lassandra.
HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush.how_to_trigger: During the ambush with the drider, after starting it with the caravan and changing sides Ctrl+Shift+K Branthos and Skywin.

PAD_BacktrackedToCaravanCheckpoint.synopsis: Players met the caravan alone or with the harpers and backtracked towards where the caravan was waiting the Drider.
PAD_BacktrackedToCaravanCheckpoint.how_to_trigger: 1. goto 13; 39; -19 or start the ambush from the harpers' side.2. Trigger the dialog SCL_Drider_HarpersAndPlayersAmbush for the VB trigger to register.3. goto 103; 56; -54

HarperMelee_000.synopsis: Harper one-line, with faith that the player will guide them to victory against the big bad Ketheric Thorm.
HarperMelee_000.how_to_trigger: Speak to the Harper before or after triggering the drider ambush.loadlevel SCL_Main_Aoe debugbook > go to region > act 2 > haven > after checkpointteleport S_SCL_Drider_HarperMelee_000

Harper_Melee_000_AD_DriderDropsLantern.synopsis: Drider drops lantern (either being disarmed or killed)
Harper_Melee_000_AD_DriderDropsLantern.how_to_trigger: Disarm or kill the drider during combat, forcing him to drop the lantern. Harper Branthos must be present, Harper Lassandra not present.

HarperRanger_001.synopsis: A Harper, possibly getting ready for a mission that will see them trying to kill a drider - a big, dangerous monster.
HarperRanger_001.how_to_trigger: Kill or silence any of the other harpers so no group dialog triggers. Or finish the ambush and meet the harper back at the inn.

AD_HarpersReachTree.synopsis: AD that triggers near a tree at the shadowlands.
AD_HarpersReachTree.how_to_trigger: Start the ambush from the side of the harpers and wait till any of them crosses the tree near -5; 30; 84.

Caravan_GoblinMelee_000.synopsis: If the player has been allowed entry to the camp, they can talk to this goblin to learn that they are waiting for a harp from Minthara with which to summon a guide that will protect them from the shadow curse on the path to Moonrise and if they haven't got it, they need to get it from Minthara. If the player has killed Minthara and hasn't already told the checkpoint goblin, they can mention it here.
Caravan_GoblinMelee_000.how_to_trigger: - Do NOT get the mission to go to Moonrise from Minthara. - Enter SCL via the mountain pass and proceed to the goblin camp below. - Gain access to the camp by talking to the checkpoint goblin. - Speak to the other goblin at the camp that has dialogue.

CaravanAmbushed.synopsis: Harpers ambush the caravan and the players. If this dialog succeeds on starting, the players can decide to fight the Harpers or change sides and help the ambushers fight the drider.

AD_CombatStarts.synopsis: Drider screams after being attacked during the ambush.
AD_CombatStarts.how_to_trigger: Begin combat with the drider when neither Harper Lassandra nor Harper Branthos are available.Observe the Drider's AD when combat begins.

AD_DroppedLantern.how_to_trigger: Disarm the drider during combat, forcing him to drop the lantern.

AD_CaravanConflict.synopsis: Kicks off conflict between two or more caravan members if they are all alive at the bridge next to the town, after the harpers' ambush.

AD_HarpersAfterAmbush.synopsis: Harpers are at the rendezvous point after the ambush reflecting about it.

HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush.synopsis: A Harper scout, getting ready to go back out into the cursed land that recently killed her friend. She's preparing to ambush a drider - a big, dangerous target. Her mood is somewhat grim.
HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush.how_to_trigger: Make Lassandra join the harpers after the first encounter with her at the shadowlands. Then kill or silence any of the other harpers so no group dialog triggers.

AD_HarperWaitingAtAmbush.synopsis: Harper is waiting for the caravan at the ambush spot.Whispered and urgent - you're about to ambush someone.
AD_HarperWaitingAtAmbush.how_to_trigger: In Last Light, agree to help the Harpers ambush the drider. Follow them to the ambush site. If any of the Harpers are dead, one of the surviving Harpers will have this AD.

HarperScout_AfterAmbush.synopsis: Lassandra after the fight with the Drider, triggers only if players started with the harpers and Lassandra was present at Haven.
HarperScout_AfterAmbush.how_to_trigger: - Load SCL_Main- oe havchec (if playing in the editor).- goto 59; 47; 155- Help the harpers and follow them.- Go through the checkpoint with Jaheira, Lassandra will move with the other harpers.- oe scl_unlockharpersambush- Speak with them at the bridge and start the quest.- Ambush the caravan, kill cultists and drider.- Before taking the lantern speak with Lassandra.

HarperRanger_000_AfterAmbush.synopsis: Harper Ranger after the fight with the Drider. You may or may not have started the fight on his side. After the ambush has ended, a prisoner threatens you, telling you to hand over the lantern.

AD_Harpers_AtInn_AfterAmbush.synopsis: | 1st case scenario : Harpers came back victorious from the drider ambush and they are chatting about it back at the inn. || 2nd case scenario : Player went at the ambush without the harpers and they are now left with no lantern and nothing to do, |

Caravan_HalfOrcMelee_AtTower.synopsis: This guard was part of the caravan that brought us to Moonrise. Looking around the tower ruins, unimpressed.

AtTower.synopsis: The Drider stands at the top of Moonrise tower - present just before we get our reward.
AtTower.how_to_trigger: Speak to the drider on MOO rooftop.

AD_Warning.synopsis: Drider warns players and caravan not to move too far away from the light - otherwise the Moonlantern won't protect them.
AD_Warning.how_to_trigger: Join the drider's caravan at the entrance to SCL. As the caravan moves through the shadow curse, walk out of the light zone the drider's lantern creates and this AD should play.

Caravan_GoblinMelee_001_AtTower.synopsis: The caravan has come to a stop at Moonrise Towers. Gronag is one of the guards idling outside until they're sent back out into the dark.
Caravan_GoblinMelee_001_AtTower.how_to_trigger: loadlevel SCL_Main_Agod ongoto 34.386; 49.025; -22.433dilog is triggered'The absolute protected me''lantern''Thank you - let's go'follow them to the towerthe goblins will enter the tower for a drinkteleport S_SCL_DriderCaravan_GoblinMelee_001OR go to -133.496; 23.899; -190.94speak w Brawler Gronag

Harper_Melee_000_AD_LassandraDies.synopsis: Lassandra dies in combat with the drider. Branthos (also in combat with the drider) reacts.

AD_HarpersReachAmbushHouse.synopsis: AD that triggers as harpers reach the house from which they will ambush the caravan.
AD_HarpersReachAmbushHouse.how_to_trigger: Start the ambush from the side of the harpers and wait till any of them arrives to 6; 35; 6.

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush.synopsis: The players have agreed to help the Harpers ambush a caravan of Absolute cultists and prisoners. You've just arrived at the ambush site - the mood is tense, words are spoken in harsh whispers. When the Caravan arrives there's a monsterous drider at its head, muttering to itself, talking to an imaginary queen/majesty that represents the voice of his God, The Absolute. The player can try to trick the drider into handing over its magic lantern (the Moonlantern - a glowing lantern hanging from the end of a staff), although that could leave the drider exposed to the worst effects of the curse. Will likely end in combat, either because you signaled the Harpers to spring their ambush or because the drider got suspicious and attacked.

HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush.synopsis: Femme Harper Ranger after the fight with the Drider. To ppath: You started the fight with the drider, but switched sides. If you don't give the Harpers the moonlantern they came for, you will need to fight them for it.
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush.how_to_trigger: From tutorialDebug book → Go to Region → Act 2 → SCL → Entry Point Mountain Pass Debug book → Act 2 Setup → Absolute path: gives Spider's lyre to unlock the Drider's path.in reCon: teleport S_SCL_DriderCaravan_HalfOrcCaster Say you are true soultalk to him again  → play lyre to draw in dridertalk to drider → choose to go to moonrise → follow drider to ambush pointIn ambush dialogue → turn on drider and side with harpersIn combat → ctrl k all harpers first except S_SCL_Drider_Harper_Ranger_001 (Harper Skywin) and then driderTalk to Harper Skywin

AD_ArriveToTollHouse.synopsis: Drider arrives to the toll house and tells everyone to stay close to him.
AD_ArriveToTollHouse.how_to_trigger: Follow the caravan and let the Drider reach S_SCL_Drider_ADAtTollHouse trigger (-78; 21; -75).

Caravan_AD_HalfOrcAndGoblinAtCheckpoint.synopsis: AD between the goblin and the half-orc when the entire caravan is at the checkpoint.

Caravan_GoblinRanger.synopsis: Goblin at the edge of the shadow curse. Misses the party back at the camp - this place is unsettling.

Caravan_GoblinMelee_000_AtTower.how_to_trigger: Summon the Drider and let him escort you and the other guides to moonrise towers, once there speak to the Goblin Vez.

AD_BeforeAmbush.synopsis: Second caravan AD between the bridge and the ambush.

CaravanStart.synopsis: Dialog featuring a goblin and half-orc. Triggers the start of the caravan escort with the Drider appearing.The Drider is male, half-drow elf and half spider (bottom half). He carries a magical lantern to ward off the shadows
CaravanStart.how_to_trigger: - go to Region: SCL -> Mountain Pass- set Act 2 Absolute Path- goto 92.91, 51.44, -50.63- talk to Kansif, perform the Lyre- talk to Drider

HarperCaster_000.synopsis: A Harper, getting ready for a mission that will see them trying to kill a drider - a big, dangerous monster. Main path only available when group dialogue is unavailable. This Harper is boisterous and eager.
HarperCaster_000.how_to_trigger: Kill or silence any of the other harpers so no group dialog triggers. Or finish the ambush and meet the harper back at the inn.

AD_AllHarpersWaitingAtAmbush.synopsis: Harper is waiting for the caravan at the ambush spot. After it the ambush starts and the caravan appears.Whispered and urgent - you're about to ambush someone.
AD_AllHarpersWaitingAtAmbush.how_to_trigger: In Last Light, agree to help the Harpers ambush the Drider. Then follow them to the ambush site. If All Harpers are alive, this AD will play as the Drider appears.

Caravan_GoblinMelee_001.synopsis: A goblin plays with a hyena (if it is still alive). Grumpy.

Harper_Melee_000_AD_PlayerTookLantern.synopsis: The Player is fighting on the side of the drider against the Harpers. The Players just picked up the lantern that Harper Branthos wants.
Harper_Melee_000_AD_PlayerTookLantern.how_to_trigger: Join ambush combat on the side of the drider.Kill or disarm the drider so he drops the lantern.Loot and equip the lantern.Observe AD from Harper Branthos.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.synopsis: Harper leader after the fight with the Drider. You started the fight on drider's side, but switched and sided with the Harpers. They take the lantern and if you want it, you need to attack them or convince them to give it to you.
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.how_to_trigger: After Ambush with Harper path:- Go to Region: Haven -> Bridge- set Act 2 Thiefling Path- pass the entrance cinematic- Go to Region: Haven -> Isobel Room- talk to Isobel -> Initiate Attack by Marcus- talk to Harper at goto -48, 135- SetGlobalOsirisFlag SCL_Drider_State_HarpersWaitingAtBridge- talk to Harpers on the bridge- follow them to Ambush site goto 0, -27- debug: Kill Combat- Talk to Harper (Branthos)After Ambush with Drider path:- go to Region: SCL -> Mountain Pass- set Act 2 Absolute Path- goto 92.91, 51.44, -50.63- talk to Kansif, perform the Lyre- talk to Drider- follow the Drider to Ambush site goto 14, -18- enter Combat, but Kill Drider- talk to the Harper (take the lantern or let Harper take the lantern).

AD_EscortInterrupted.synopsis: Drider pauses the escort because someone was left behind. Drider's tone is a little sharp - it's his responsibility to make sure the caravan he's escorting gets to its destination safely.
AD_EscortInterrupted.how_to_trigger: (Escort behaviour WIP)Once is done, start the escort and move away from the caravan.

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster.synopsis: Player approaches Kansif (a stoic, honourable male half-orc) and Brawler Vez (a mouthy female goblin) after clearing a checkpoint and entering their camp in the Shadowcurse. They two Absolute cultists assume you're a True Soul sent by Minthara (which may or may not be true) and will ask if you brought the lyre needed to summon their guide through the darkness. If you have, you can play it and the drider will emerge. If you haven't, they can tell you where to find it.
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster.how_to_trigger: - Use debug book to reach SCL (Go to Region -> Act 2 -> SCL -> Mountain Pass).- Speak to the goblin that warns you about the curse, take a torch, and head down the path. - The goblin camp is to your south/left.- Speak to the goblin at the checkpoint.- Then enter the camp and speak to Kansiff on the wooden platform.

AD_TollhouseFight.synopsis: Drider sees any of the tollhouse collector booster NPCs in combat while traversing the tollhouse in TWN.
AD_TollhouseFight.how_to_trigger: Start the encounter and move anyone from the tollhouse collector booster to the lower floor near the Drider's path. Trigger the escort and follow the drider.

HarperRanger_000.synopsis: A Harper, proposing a mission that will see them trying to kill a drider.
HarperRanger_000.how_to_trigger: Kill or silence any of the other harpers so no group dialog triggers. Or finish the ambush and meet the harper back at the inn.

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_AtTower.synopsis: Kansif is now safe inside Moonrise Towers after delivering us there.

Caravan_GoblinMelee_001_AD_AtCheckpoint.synopsis: Goblin at the checkpoint on the lookout for intruders while waiting for the drider.

CINE_CaravanIntro.synopsis: The player spots the drider caravan approaching while exploring SCL (no harpers are present)
CINE_CaravanIntro.how_to_trigger: Approach X:-8 Y:-27 in the shadow-cursed lands.

HarperCaster_000_AfterAmbush.synopsis: Harper Caster after the fight with the Drider. You probably started the fight and switched sides to harpers. If so, you need to let them have the moonlantern or fight to keep it.

Caravan_AD_Hyena.synopsis: A playful, tame hyena is hanging around a goblin guard named Grim. Grim's having none of it.
Caravan_AD_Hyena.how_to_trigger: Hang around near S_SCL_DriderCaravan_GoblinMelee_001 until the AD triggers.

AD_KillsSomeone.synopsis: Drider kills someone during the ambush encounter.
AD_KillsSomeone.how_to_trigger: Begin combat with the drider (either joining him in the caravan or ambushing him with the Harpers)Observe the AD when the drider kills an enemy.

Caravan_AD_GoblinMelee_001.synopsis: One line combat AD for Warrior Gronag in the Drider Caravan
Caravan_AD_GoblinMelee_001.how_to_trigger: Get in to combat with the Drider caravan in SCL

WaitingDuringEscort.synopsis: Players were following the Drider accross the shadowlands but moved too far away from the caravan. The Drider will wait for the player to speak with it again before resuming the movement towards the tower.
WaitingDuringEscort.how_to_trigger: (Not implemented yet, waiting for escort behaviour to be fully implemented)- Start escort with caravan.- Don't move and wait for the Drider to walk away.- Drider will stop and wait for the player.

AD_PlayerTakesMoonlantern.synopsis: Player takes the moonlantern and wasn't on the drider's side.

Harper_Melee_000_AD_TakesMoonlantern.synopsis: Harper takes the moolantern from the drider.

AD_Harper_Melee_000_0.speaker: Harper Branthos
AD_Harper_Melee_000_0.text: I fear neither shadow nor death.
AD_Harper_Melee_000_0.context: NodeContext: during combat, like a prayer, reassuring self

AD_HarpersPreparingBeforeAmbush_0.speaker: Harper Manus
AD_HarpersPreparingBeforeAmbush_0.text: Haven't we waited long enough, Bran?

AD_HarpersPreparingBeforeAmbush_11.speaker: Harper Branthos
AD_HarpersPreparingBeforeAmbush_11.text: We'll wait as long as it takes.

AD_HarpersPreparingBeforeAmbush_10.speaker: Harper Manus
AD_HarpersPreparingBeforeAmbush_10.text: As long as it takes for what?

AD_HarpersPreparingBeforeAmbush_8.speaker: Harper Branthos
AD_HarpersPreparingBeforeAmbush_8.text: For the winds to blow in our favour.

AD_HarpersPreparingBeforeAmbush_1.speaker: Harper Branthos
AD_HarpersPreparingBeforeAmbush_1.text: At ease, Harpers - but stay close by.

AD_HarpersPreparingBeforeAmbush_12.speaker: Harper Branthos
AD_HarpersPreparingBeforeAmbush_12.text: When the times comes, move quick, move quiet.

AD_HarpersPreparingBeforeAmbush_2.speaker: Harper Skywin
AD_HarpersPreparingBeforeAmbush_2.text: And just when will that be?

Caravan_GoblinRanger_AtTower_0.speaker: Sharp-Eye Lora
Caravan_GoblinRanger_AtTower_0.text: No food waiting for us? 'S barbaric. They got plenty of prisoners for the roasting.
Caravan_GoblinRanger_AtTower_0.context: NodeContext: whining - end of a long shift and they haven't been fed

Caravan_GoblinRanger_AtTower_1.speaker: Sharp-Eye Lora
Caravan_GoblinRanger_AtTower_1.text: Good luck inside the tower, boss. Better you than me.
Caravan_GoblinRanger_AtTower_1.context: NodeContext: Just a common soldier and aspiring to no more - doesn't envy the circles we swim in

Harper_Melee_000_AD_CombatStarts_0.speaker: Harper Branthos
Harper_Melee_000_AD_CombatStarts_0.text: Take out the drider - we need that lantern!

AD_HarpersMoveTowardsAmbush_0.speaker: Harper Branthos
AD_HarpersMoveTowardsAmbush_0.context: NodeContext: Very tense, but not shouting. Close to a loud whisper.

PlayersAmbush_70.speaker: Kar'niss
PlayersAmbush_70.text: Step into the light! Let us see you.

PlayersAmbush_99.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player moves into the light. Player's positioning should match N218 so it merges into the rest of the dialog flow

PlayersAmbush_90.speaker: Narrator
PlayersAmbush_90.text: *Your minds connect and you hear a voice whispering to you. The Absolute? Or just the echoes of his fractured mind, reverberating in the darkness?*

PlayersAmbush_12.speaker: Kar'niss
PlayersAmbush_12.text: One of your True Souls, my Queen! How have they survived?
PlayersAmbush_12.context: CinematicNodeContext: Scuttles forward, holding the lantern to illuminate the player's face

PlayersAmbush_43.speaker: Kar'niss
PlayersAmbush_43.text: You blessed them too, my Queen? Where is their lantern?

PlayersAmbush_50.speaker: Player
PlayersAmbush_50.text: The Absolute guided me here. She said a mere drider was not worthy - that I must take your lantern.

PlayersAmbush_96.speaker: Player
PlayersAmbush_96.text: Our wondrous Queen dropped me a message - she said you need to give me that lantern. It's very important.

PlayersAmbush_74.speaker: Player
PlayersAmbush_74.text: You're holding my lantern. The Absolute said you had to give it to me.

PlayersAmbush_88.speaker: Player
PlayersAmbush_88.text: The Absolute guided me to you. She said I was to take yours.

PlayersAmbush_51.speaker: Kar'niss
PlayersAmbush_51.text: But majesty, you gave this lantern to me. You said it was mine!

PlayersAmbush_47.speaker: Kar'niss
PlayersAmbush_47.text: No, we will keep your gift and drive this false one back into the dark!

PlayersAmbush_108.speaker: Player
PlayersAmbush_108.text: I would use True Soul Nere's lantern, but it broke.

PlayersAmbush_105.speaker: Kar'niss
PlayersAmbush_105.text: Nere? A fickle, unworthy servant to our Queen.

PlayersAmbush_39.speaker: Player
PlayersAmbush_39.text: Lantern? Is that what protects you out here?

PlayersAmbush_83.speaker: Kar'niss
PlayersAmbush_83.text: Our goddess protects us. We carry her sacred light to drive back the shadows.
PlayersAmbush_83.context: NodeContext: 'Sacred light' referring to the Moonlantern

PlayersAmbush_87.speaker: Kar'niss
PlayersAmbush_87.text: Yes, majesty, your light can shield another of your faithful. They will join us on the road.

PlayersAmbush_32.speaker: Player
PlayersAmbush_32.text: No - that lantern is mine, by order of the Absolute. Give it - now.

PlayersAmbush_20.speaker: Kar'niss
PlayersAmbush_20.text: Majesty? Is - is this true? Did I not serve you well?

PlayersAmbush_24.speaker: Kar'niss
PlayersAmbush_24.text: Very well. If it is your will, they can have it.
PlayersAmbush_24.context: CinematicNodeContext: Drider throws the Moonlantern to the ground in angerNodeContext: Drider throws the Moonlantern to the ground in anger

PlayersAmbush_2.speaker: Player
PlayersAmbush_2.text: So how does this work, exactly?

PlayersAmbush_13.speaker: Kar'niss
PlayersAmbush_13.text: They don't know? Our Queen told them nothing?

PlayersAmbush_0.speaker: Kar'niss
PlayersAmbush_0.text: She has blessed the lantern's light. It is the Absolute who protects us from the shadows.
PlayersAmbush_0.context: NodeContext: Stress on first word. "*She* has blessed this light."

PlayersAmbush_57.speaker: Player
PlayersAmbush_57.text: Protects us from what? What are the shadows, exactly?

PlayersAmbush_33.speaker: Kar'niss
PlayersAmbush_33.text: Simply shadows. Cursed, hungry shadows, trying to grab the living. And they are getting stronger.

PlayersAmbush_97.speaker: Kar'niss
PlayersAmbush_97.text: But do not worry, there is still power in the lantern. Our queen will protect you, as she protected me.

PlayersAmbush_14.speaker: Player
PlayersAmbush_14.text: Indeed, it's time for you to go.

PlayersAmbush_10.speaker: Kar'niss
PlayersAmbush_10.text: This is not her Majesty's will.

PlayersAmbush_34.speaker: Player
PlayersAmbush_34.text: I am both a True Soul and a cleric. I've blessed you with the power of the Absolute - you'll be safe.

PlayersAmbush_95.speaker: Player
PlayersAmbush_95.text: Securus! There - you now carry the blessing of the Absolute. You'll be safe.

PlayersAmbush_102.speaker: Player
PlayersAmbush_102.text: Vale, idiotae! There - you now carry the blessing of the Absolute. You'll be safe.

PlayersAmbush_77.speaker: Player
PlayersAmbush_77.text: (Wave hands.) There - you now carry the blessing of the Absolute. You'll be safe.

PlayersAmbush_92.speaker: Player
PlayersAmbush_92.text: The Absolute has blessed you. You will be safe.

PlayersAmbush_19.speaker: Player
PlayersAmbush_19.text: The Absolute wants you to go. Now!

PlayersAmbush_22.speaker: Kar'niss
PlayersAmbush_22.text: If - if it is her majesty's will...

PlayersAmbush_85.speaker: Kansif
PlayersAmbush_85.text: You can't be serious. You know what's out there-

PlayersAmbush_63.speaker: Kar'niss
PlayersAmbush_63.text: IF IT IS HER MAJESTY'S WILL, THEN WE SHALL WALK!

PlayersAmbush_106.speaker: Kar'niss
PlayersAmbush_106.text: She will protect us. She - she must.

PlayersAmbush_29.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The HALF-ORC shoots you a dirty look, but follows the DRIDER into the darkness, along with the other cultists. There is silence for a beat before screams start to pierce the air. There is sound of a brief battle. 

To account for Vez being dead or alive we will rely on a Show Actor key in Node N858.

PlayersAmbush_58.speaker: Kar'niss
PlayersAmbush_58.context: CinematicNodeContext: Off screen, cries from the darkness, which fade to an eerie silence.NodeContext: Off screen, being killed by shadow monsters. He cries out, begging his god to save him, but it's too late

PlayersAmbush_66.speaker: Narrator
PlayersAmbush_66.text: *As the sounds fade, there is nothing left but cold, still silence.*

PlayersAmbush_1.speaker: Kar'niss
PlayersAmbush_1.text: They think us fools, Majesty. They think we cannot see through their lies.

PlayersAmbush_17.speaker: Kar'niss
PlayersAmbush_17.text: We will punish them for this blasphemy. We will make them scream!

PlayersAmbush_37.speaker: Player
PlayersAmbush_37.text: If we in the Underdark, I would split you open, drider. Leave before I change my mind.

PlayersAmbush_53.speaker: Player
PlayersAmbush_53.text: Question me again, and I will make drag you into the darkness - screaming.

PlayersAmbush_54.speaker: Kar'niss
PlayersAmbush_54.text: But majesty, you gave this lantern to me. You said it was mine!

PlayersAmbush_15.speaker: Kar'niss
PlayersAmbush_15.text: No, we will keep your gift and drive this false one back into the dark!

PlayersAmbush_40.speaker: Player
PlayersAmbush_40.text: That lantern is mine - by order of the Absolute. Drop it, or I'll shatter your spine as the wind breaks a twig.

PlayersAmbush_98.speaker: Player
PlayersAmbush_98.text: That lantern is mine - by order of the Absolute. Drop it, or I'll boil your brain inside your skull.

PlayersAmbush_45.speaker: Player
PlayersAmbush_45.text: The Absolute has asked me to carry the lantern. Hand it over.

PlayersAmbush_52.speaker: Kar'niss
PlayersAmbush_52.text: They will follow close. Do not leave the light!
PlayersAmbush_52.context: CinematicNodeContext: Drider turns and starts to leave, ready to head into the dark. You're expected to follow.

PlayersAmbush_64.speaker: Player
PlayersAmbush_64.text: Or I could kill you and take that light.

PlayersAmbush_38.speaker: Player
PlayersAmbush_38.text: Never mind me, how have you survived the curse?

PlayersAmbush_101.speaker: Kar'niss
PlayersAmbush_101.text: To have a rage so fierce the dark quivers - you must have blessed them, my Queen! But if so... where is their lantern?

PlayersAmbush_86.speaker: Player
PlayersAmbush_86.text: I am not one of hers - divine light guides my footfall.

PlayersAmbush_56.speaker: Kar'niss
PlayersAmbush_56.text: There is but one god - and she is Absolute.

PlayersAmbush_82.speaker: Player
PlayersAmbush_82.text: Takes more than shadows to put someone like me down.

PlayersAmbush_6.speaker: Kar'niss
PlayersAmbush_6.text: A mere mortal warrior could have never persevered alone... Ah! Of course!

PlayersAmbush_9.speaker: Player
PlayersAmbush_9.text: I have tested my mind and body beyond to its absolute limits - I do not fear the darkness.

PlayersAmbush_25.speaker: Player
PlayersAmbush_25.text: With the aid of my mind and my magic, for I am a master of both.

PlayersAmbush_84.speaker: Kar'niss
PlayersAmbush_84.text: Magic alone could never have persevered... Ah! Of course!

PlayersAmbush_26.speaker: Player
PlayersAmbush_26.text: I swore an oath - a powerful one. It will take more than darkness to end me.

PlayersAmbush_59.speaker: Kar'niss
PlayersAmbush_59.text: Ah, you swore an oath to my Queen! But if so... where is their lantern?

PlayersAmbush_55.speaker: Player
PlayersAmbush_55.text: You know what they say - a ballad a day, keeps the darkness away!

PlayersAmbush_8.speaker: Kar'niss
PlayersAmbush_8.text: To make the darkness quiver with mere song - you must have blessed them, my Queen. But if so... where is their lantern?

PlayersAmbush_69.speaker: Player
PlayersAmbush_69.text: No higher forces protect me - I survived by my own tenacity.

PlayersAmbush_7.speaker: Player
PlayersAmbush_7.text: I am a guardian of nature - and in return nature protects me.

PlayersAmbush_31.speaker: Kar'niss
PlayersAmbush_31.text: But the druids have no power here, not since... Ah, of course!

PlayersAmbush_18.speaker: Player
PlayersAmbush_18.text: Navigating dangerous terrain is second nature to me.

PlayersAmbush_46.speaker: Player
PlayersAmbush_46.text: I burn with pure arcana - how on earth do you survive?

HarpersAtInn_57.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarpersAtInn_57.text: You mean to reach Moonrise. And I've orders to help you.

HarpersAtInn_34.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarpersAtInn_34.text: The path to the Towers is drenched in blackness so deep, even a torch cannot quell it.

HarpersAtInn_32.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarpersAtInn_32.text: Yet the cultists have found a way to move freely. Whatever this method, you must claim it.

HarpersAtInn_64.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarpersAtInn_64.text: A cultist convoy crosses the land as we speak. I've readied an ambush. Say the word, and we fly.

HarpersAtInn_41.speaker: Lae'zel
HarpersAtInn_41.text: A Moonlantern - it must be. And we must take it. Githyanki perish in bloodbaths, not dreary curses.

HarpersAtInn_59.speaker: Shadowheart
HarpersAtInn_59.text: Sounds like a Moonlantern - that's just what we need.

HarpersAtInn_13.speaker: Karlach
HarpersAtInn_13.text: Gotta be a Moonlantern. Just what we need.

HarpersAtInn_50.speaker: Astarion
HarpersAtInn_50.text: A Moonlantern, surely? I would love to have one of those.

HarpersAtInn_25.speaker: Wyll
HarpersAtInn_25.text: A Moonlantern, I wager. There's no overstating the advantage we'll gain with that light.

HarpersAtInn_17.speaker: Gale
HarpersAtInn_17.text: If they move freely, they must have a Moonlantern. Let's have a little war with that convoy and claim the spoils.

HarpersAtInn_5.speaker: Lae'zel
HarpersAtInn_5.text: We must take this advantage. Githyanki perish in bloodbaths, not dreary curses.

HarpersAtInn_22.speaker: Shadowheart
HarpersAtInn_22.text: Sounds like just what we need to get to Moonrise.

HarpersAtInn_2.speaker: Karlach
HarpersAtInn_2.text: Fuck yes - let's do it! I want to crush something evil.

HarpersAtInn_29.speaker: Player
HarpersAtInn_29.text: Let's take on that convoy. You lead, I follow.

HarpersAtInn_40.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarpersAtInn_40.text: Splendid. I'll mark your map, should you lose the way.

HarpersAtInn_33.speaker: Harper Lassandra
HarpersAtInn_33.text: So glad to have you. Truly.

HarpersAtInn_54.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarpersAtInn_54.text: Harpers - with me. Stray no more than an arm's length from your course.

HarpersAtInn_62.speaker: Player
HarpersAtInn_62.text: Go on ahead. I'll catch up.

HarpersAtInn_66.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarpersAtInn_66.text: As you say. I'll mark your map with the rendezvous point.

HarpersAtInn_31.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarpersAtInn_31.text: Don't be long. Our window of chance will close all too quickly.

HarpersAtInn_45.speaker: Player
HarpersAtInn_45.text: Jaheira said Isobel had a way to keep me safe.

HarpersAtInn_43.speaker: Player
HarpersAtInn_43.text: Shouldn't Isobel's blessing keep me safe?

HarpersAtInn_24.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarpersAtInn_24.text: Isobel's blessing is a palliative, not a cure. Some shadows, even her magic can't counter.

HarpersAtInn_35.speaker: Player
HarpersAtInn_35.text: Wait here. I need time to prepare.

HarpersAtInn_52.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarpersAtInn_52.text: My feet are planted deep 'til you return.

HarpersAtInn_65.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarpersAtInn_65.text: But don't tarry. The greater the opportunity, the shorter its visit.

HarpersAtInn_21.speaker: Player
HarpersAtInn_21.text: You're too late - I've encountered the convoy, led by a drider.

HarpersAtInn_4.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarpersAtInn_4.text: What? Hideous beast! It is a miracle you're alive.

HarpersAtInn_0.speaker: Player
HarpersAtInn_0.text: Not just alive - victorious. I killed it.

HarpersAtInn_3.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarpersAtInn_3.text: Holy hells. Incredible, that it didn't tear off your every limb.

HarpersAtInn_60.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarpersAtInn_60.text: And their means of safe passage - do you have it?

HarpersAtInn_42.speaker: Player
HarpersAtInn_42.text: I wasn't able to retrieve it, I'm afraid. The way will be dark indeed.

HarpersAtInn_48.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarpersAtInn_48.text: Hells. Then our chance has passed.

HarpersAtInn_37.speaker: Player
HarpersAtInn_37.text: Forget the convoy. I can handle myself out there.

HarpersAtInn_49.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarpersAtInn_49.text: Is that it, then? I'm no stranger to indifference, True Soul.

HarpersAtInn_8.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarpersAtInn_8.text: Just as I'm no stranger to the scars it leaves behind.

HarpersAtInn_10.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarpersAtInn_10.text: But - there will be more chances. You'll make them. It's what you do.

HarpersAtInn_30.speaker: Player
HarpersAtInn_30.text: Yes, I've taken their light. I will be safe in its glow.

HarpersAtInn_46.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarpersAtInn_46.text: I'll be damned - you're something else.

HarpersAtInn_38.speaker: Player
HarpersAtInn_38.text: A magic lantern. It'll help. But it's only a tool, not a solution.

HarpersAtInn_63.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarpersAtInn_63.text: Go, then - Moonrise Towers awaits. But know this:

HarpersAtInn_15.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarpersAtInn_15.text: You don't just fight shadows. You fight what hides inside.

HarpersAtInn_53.speaker: Player
HarpersAtInn_53.text: Forget the convoy. I am your saviour here, not some magic lamp.

HarpersAtInn_19.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarpersAtInn_19.text: Mind the gap between confidence and arrogance, True Soul. That's where true danger lies.

HarpersAtInn_20.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarpersAtInn_20.text: Go on, then - take your lantern, or not. Moonrise is waiting.

HarpersAtInn_51.speaker: Player
HarpersAtInn_51.text: I stayed well out of its way. There was no chance of it spotting me.

HarpersAtInn_23.speaker: Player
HarpersAtInn_23.text: I only saw its trail. It was fresh.

HarpersAtInn_44.speaker: Player
HarpersAtInn_44.text: Not a miracle - I was simply careful. I saw its light in the distance.

HarpersAtInn_58.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarpersAtInn_58.text: Then it has already travelled to Moonrise.

HarpersAtInn_47.speaker: Astarion
HarpersAtInn_47.text: Sounds like an opportunity. And it would be nice to surprise the Absolute for once.

HarpersAtInn_7.speaker: Wyll
HarpersAtInn_7.text: I'm with the Harper, chief. We should take every advantage in reach.

HarpersAtInn_28.speaker: Gale
HarpersAtInn_28.text: If they move freely, they must have some kind of magic that protects them. I'm not averse to claiming that magic indeed.

HarpersAtInn_61.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarpersAtInn_61.text: Say the word, and we set the ambush in motion.

PAD_TakeLanternAfterAmbush_0.speaker: Player
PAD_TakeLanternAfterAmbush_0.text: Excellent - now all I need is that lantern.

Caravan_AD_HalfOrcCaster_0.speaker: Kansif
Caravan_AD_HalfOrcCaster_0.text: You will die here - the Absolute wills it so!

AD_Harper_Caster_000_0.speaker: Harper Elindale
AD_Harper_Caster_000_0.context: NodeContext: wary but energetic, in combat

Caravan_AD_MeleeAndRangerGoblinsAtCheckp.speaker: Brawler Vez
Caravan_AD_MeleeAndRangerGoblinsAtCheckp.context: NodeContext: A companion has complained about the quiet. This a pointed response - to shut up.

Caravan_AD_MeleeAndRangerGoblinsAtCheckp.speaker: Sharp-Eye Lora
Caravan_AD_MeleeAndRangerGoblinsAtCheckp.text: Don't fancy following that leggy nutter again.

Caravan_AD_MeleeAndRangerGoblinsAtCheckp.speaker: Brawler Vez
Caravan_AD_MeleeAndRangerGoblinsAtCheckp.text: Stay 'ere then. See if you like the shadows any better.

Caravan_AD_MeleeAndRangerGoblinsAtCheckp.speaker: Sharp-Eye Lora
Caravan_AD_MeleeAndRangerGoblinsAtCheckp.text: Ain't you worried about the shadows?

Caravan_AD_MeleeAndRangerGoblinsAtCheckp.speaker: Brawler Vez
Caravan_AD_MeleeAndRangerGoblinsAtCheckp.text: Nope. 'Cause I ain't a little coward.

Caravan_AD_MeleeAndRangerGoblinsAtCheckp.speaker: Sharp-Eye Lora
Caravan_AD_MeleeAndRangerGoblinsAtCheckp.text: You can be right unkind, you know that?
Caravan_AD_MeleeAndRangerGoblinsAtCheckp.context: NodeContext: Taking issue with a companion who's always mocking him

Caravan_AD_MeleeAndRangerGoblinsAtCheckp.speaker: Brawler Vez
Caravan_AD_MeleeAndRangerGoblinsAtCheckp.text: Aw. Hugs and kisses when we get back to Moonrise then, yeah?

AD_AfterTollhouse_1.speaker: Brawler Vez
AD_AfterTollhouse_1.text: There's the tower now, big lad. Your breeches still clean?
AD_AfterTollhouse_1.context: NodeContext: talking to a half-orc fellow-cultist, not to player

AD_AfterTollhouse_0.speaker: Kansif
AD_AfterTollhouse_0.text: My blade is. But that can change - just keep talking.
AD_AfterTollhouse_0.context: NodeContext: talking to a goblin who disrespected you, but it's a mostly-friendly rivalry

AD_AfterTollhouse_2.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_AfterTollhouse_2.text: They will be silent! They approach your sanctuary, Majesty.
AD_AfterTollhouse_2.context: NodeContext: 'they' are cultists he's leading, slightly crazed, talking to his 'god'

ThanksAfterAmbush_42.speaker: Kar'niss
ThanksAfterAmbush_42.text: And what of the strange little turncoat, Majesty? Should we spare them?

ThanksAfterAmbush_13.speaker: Narrator
ThanksAfterAmbush_13.text: *Your minds connect and you hear a whispered voice. The Absolute? Or just the echoes of his fractured mind, reverberating in the dark?*

ThanksAfterAmbush_12.speaker: Kar'niss
ThanksAfterAmbush_12.text: A True Soul. Why would one of our queen's blessed walk with Harpers?

ThanksAfterAmbush_14.speaker: Kar'niss
ThanksAfterAmbush_14.text: They are holier than me - a greater part of Her design! I was wrong to question them!
ThanksAfterAmbush_14.context: CinematicNodeContext: detect thoughts node - this is the creature's thoughts rather than direct speechNodeContext: detect thoughts node - this is the creature's thoughts rather than direct speech

ThanksAfterAmbush_58.speaker: Kar'niss
ThanksAfterAmbush_58.text: So many voices inside my mind, so many - but these ones are tricksters and thieves!
ThanksAfterAmbush_58.context: NodeContext: angry and confused - somebody just tried to steal thougths from your mind

ThanksAfterAmbush_2.speaker: Player
ThanksAfterAmbush_2.text: Do not question your superiors, creature. My orders come directly from the Absolute.

ThanksAfterAmbush_57.speaker: Kar'niss
ThanksAfterAmbush_57.text: Yes, yes, of course. Her grace burns bright in them - I see it!

ThanksAfterAmbush_39.speaker: Player
ThanksAfterAmbush_39.text: I infiltrated their ranks - gathering information for our cause.

ThanksAfterAmbush_17.speaker: Kar'niss
ThanksAfterAmbush_17.text: Very well. We welcome all who follow our holy queen.

ThanksAfterAmbush_54.speaker: Kar'niss
ThanksAfterAmbush_54.text: Are they ready to depart? We do not want to linger in the shadows, Majesty.

ThanksAfterAmbush_61.speaker: Kar'niss
ThanksAfterAmbush_61.text: Follow close - the shadows are hungry. Do not stray from the light.

ThanksAfterAmbush_20.speaker: Player
ThanksAfterAmbush_20.text: Give me a moment, I'm not ready to go yet.

ThanksAfterAmbush_68.speaker: Kar'niss
ThanksAfterAmbush_68.text: We will wait, but not for long.

ThanksAfterAmbush_36.speaker: Kar'niss
ThanksAfterAmbush_36.text: They think us fools, Majesty. They think we don't see through their lies!

ThanksAfterAmbush_66.speaker: Player
ThanksAfterAmbush_66.text: I answer to the Absolute, not to you.

ThanksAfterAmbush_24.speaker: Player
ThanksAfterAmbush_24.text: Don't you dare speak to me, you abomination!

ThanksAfterAmbush_59.speaker: Kar'niss
ThanksAfterAmbush_59.text: Very well. We depart when you are ready.

ThanksAfterAmbush_74.speaker: Player
ThanksAfterAmbush_74.text: You'll wait here. I'll tell you when I'm ready.

ThanksAfterAmbush_81.speaker: Kar'niss
ThanksAfterAmbush_81.text: How dare they - we are all equal in our queen's crusade. To say otherwise is heresy!

ThanksAfterAmbush_56.speaker: Kar'niss
ThanksAfterAmbush_56.text: Wretched little things. No better than the shadows.

ThanksAfterAmbush_38.speaker: Kar'niss
ThanksAfterAmbush_38.text: But no matter, Majesty. They are already dead, and soon forgotten.

ThanksAfterAmbush_28.speaker: Kar'niss
ThanksAfterAmbush_28.text: Perhaps they wish to stop our Queen's great mission. But we are not concerned.

ThanksAfterAmbush_22.speaker: Kar'niss
ThanksAfterAmbush_22.text: You will wipe away all opposition, Majesty. Nothing can stand in the way of Your glory.

ThanksAfterAmbush_48.speaker: Kar'niss
ThanksAfterAmbush_48.text: The sooner we reach Moonrise, the sooner you will see Her power.

ThanksAfterAmbush_37.speaker: Player
ThanksAfterAmbush_37.text: Examine one of the bodies, looking for the magic protecting them out here.

ThanksAfterAmbush_19.speaker: Player
ThanksAfterAmbush_19.text: You feel a familiar power from the bodies. Try to find its source.

ThanksAfterAmbush_86.speaker: Narrator
ThanksAfterAmbush_86.text: *You notice something odd on the fallen soldier - a faint glow about the face, like an aura fast-fading.*

ThanksAfterAmbush_80.speaker: Narrator
ThanksAfterAmbush_80.text: *You can feel the power it held - weak, but still divine. These soldiers were protected from the shadows by a blessing of Selûne.*

ThanksAfterAmbush_63.speaker: Narrator
ThanksAfterAmbush_63.text: *You can feel the power it held - weak, but still divine. These soldiers were protected from the shadows by your own lady Selûne.*

ThanksAfterAmbush_78.speaker: Kar'niss
ThanksAfterAmbush_78.text: All dead, majesty. It is time for us to move on.

ThanksAfterAmbush_0.speaker: Player
ThanksAfterAmbush_0.text: They're protected from the curse by a power like your lantern - but weaker.

ThanksAfterAmbush_4.speaker: Kar'niss
ThanksAfterAmbush_4.text: Because their gods are weaker. None compare to the Absolute.

ThanksAfterAmbush_31.speaker: Player
ThanksAfterAmbush_31.text: I need a moment to look around.

ThanksAfterAmbush_16.speaker: Kar'niss
ThanksAfterAmbush_16.text: They will hurry, Majesty. They must not keep you waiting.

ThanksAfterAmbush_72.speaker: Kar'niss
ThanksAfterAmbush_72.text: Come, follow us to Moonrise Towers. Then you will see Her power in all its glory.

ThanksAfterAmbush_53.speaker: Kar'niss
ThanksAfterAmbush_53.text: Follow close. We shall lead them home, Majesty.

ThanksAfterAmbush_75.speaker: Narrator
ThanksAfterAmbush_75.text: *You can feel the power it held - weak, but still divine. These soldiers were protected from Your Lady's shadows by her wretched sister Selûne.*

ThanksAfterAmbush_33.speaker: Narrator
ThanksAfterAmbush_33.text: *Aside from the wounds of battle, you can't see anything unusual.*

ThanksAfterAmbush_40.speaker: Player
ThanksAfterAmbush_40.text: You feel a familiar power from the bodies. Try to find its source.

ThanksAfterAmbush_84.speaker: Player
ThanksAfterAmbush_84.text: Give me a moment. I want to look around.

ThanksAfterAmbush_18.speaker: Player
ThanksAfterAmbush_18.text: It was a pleasure to kill by your side. Onwards, in death!

ThanksAfterAmbush_11.speaker: Kar'niss
ThanksAfterAmbush_11.text: Yes, we have our duty. We shall lead them home, Majesty.

ThanksAfterAmbush_77.speaker: Player
ThanksAfterAmbush_77.text: Let's go. We need to reach Moonrise.

ThanksAfterAmbush_3.speaker: Player
ThanksAfterAmbush_3.text: You never said there were others out here. Who are they?

ThanksAfterAmbush_73.speaker: Kar'niss
ThanksAfterAmbush_73.text: Harpers. Spies. Little scurrying rats, trying to stop our queen's great mission.

ThanksAfterAmbush_25.speaker: Kar'niss
ThanksAfterAmbush_25.text: But they will fail. They cannot hope to stand in our way, Majesty.

ThanksAfterAmbush_76.speaker: Kar'niss
ThanksAfterAmbush_76.text: They must get on. They must hurry.

ThanksAfterAmbush_52.speaker: Player
ThanksAfterAmbush_52.text: 'They' just need another moment. I won't be long.

ThanksAfterAmbush_65.speaker: Kar'niss
ThanksAfterAmbush_65.text: Do not linger. Must not linger.

ThanksAfterAmbush_21.speaker: Player
ThanksAfterAmbush_21.text: To Moonrise, then - lead the way.

ThanksAfterAmbush_82.speaker: Kar'niss
ThanksAfterAmbush_82.text: Are they ready, Majesty? Can we leave?

Caravan_HalfOrcMelee_0.speaker: Bedi
Caravan_HalfOrcMelee_0.text: Stay sharp. These shadows can sneak up on you.

Caravan_HalfOrcMelee_1.speaker: Bedi
Caravan_HalfOrcMelee_1.text: Don't wander into the dark. It's hungry.
Caravan_HalfOrcMelee_1.context: NodeContext: 'It's hungry' referring to the 'dark' itself. Figuratively, but also the darkness is cursed and will kill you.

AD_AfterAmbush_0.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_AfterAmbush_0.text: Shadows and heretics, Majesty. But they won't stop us. They can't stop us.
AD_AfterAmbush_0.context: NodeContext: Outburst - a little crazed as a whispering he's been hearing picks up again

Harper_Melee_000_AD_DriderDies_0.speaker: Harper Branthos
Harper_Melee_000_AD_DriderDies_0.text: Big and ugly's down - grab the lantern!

HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush_7.speaker: Harper Elindale, Harper Lassandra, Harper Manus

HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush_13.speaker: Narrator
HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush_13.text: *You hold the lantern aloft. Its glow warms you through, chasing away the shadows in and around you.*

HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush_29.speaker: Narrator
HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush_29.text: *The lantern flickers ever so briefly, and you hear a slight twitter - or perhaps it's simply your imagination.*
HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush_29.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera shows lantern in player's hand. The light flickers just a little, and you hear a little titter come from it. Player stows the lantern.

HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush_35.speaker: Narrator
HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush_35.text: *The hunter holds the lantern aloft. Its glow warms you through, chasing away the shadows in and around you.*

HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush_18.speaker: Narrator
HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush_18.text: *The lantern flickers ever so briefly, and you hear a slight twitter - or perhaps it's simply your imagination.*
HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush_18.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera shows lantern in Harper's hand. The light flickers just a little, and you hear a little titter come from it. Harper stows the lantern.

HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush_15.speaker: Narrator
HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush_15.text: *The hunter warns you to remain still, considering why a cultist would turn on its kind.*
HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush_15.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to player. Harper raises his blade and points at the player.NodeContext: Singular they.

HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush_26.speaker: Narrator
HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush_26.text: *They motion for you to hand over the lantern. They will take it and guide you to safe refuge.*

HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush_36.speaker: Player
HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush_36.text: What sort of refuge do you mean?

HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush_16.speaker: Narrator
HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush_16.text: *They tell you of an inn called Last Light, and promises you will be safe there.*

HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush_41.speaker: Narrator
HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush_41.text: *They thank you and mark the destination on your map, should you lose the way.*
HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush_41.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player hands lantern to Harper, who takes it and puts it in inventory. Fine to show only basic upper-body motions.NodeContext: Singular they

HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush_33.speaker: Narrator
HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush_33.text: *You no longer carry the lantern. The hunter frowns, and readies for battle.*

HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush_27.speaker: Player
HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush_27.text: Sorry. I don't have it anymore.

HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush_9.speaker: Player
HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush_9.text: How about I just kill you and keep the lantern for myself?

HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush_3.speaker: Narrator
HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush_3.text: *They sigh and offer to guide you to a nearby refuge.*

HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush_42.speaker: Player
HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush_42.text: I will make my way there in my own time.

HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush_2.speaker: Player
HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush_2.text: My goddess protects me. I don't fear the dark.

HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush_19.speaker: Narrator
HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush_19.text: *The Harper demands an explanation. Why did you travel with cultists?*
HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush_19.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to player. Harper raises his blade and points at the player.NodeContext: Very suspicious

HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush_6.speaker: Player
HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush_6.text: I meant to infiltrate the cult. You've ruined the mission.

HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush_11.speaker: Narrator
HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush_11.text: *The Harper acknowledges your explanation, grateful to see you in one piece.*
HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush_11.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harper lowers blade while speaking.

HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush_38.speaker: Narrator
HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush_38.text: *They hand you the Moonlantern. You bask in its glow.*
HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush_38.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harper hands player the MoonlanternNodeContext: Singular they

HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush_5.speaker: Narrator
HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush_5.text: *Lastly, the Harper wishes you well. The path to Moonrise Towers is arduous - but you will overcome.*

HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush_34.speaker: Narrator
HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush_34.text: *The Harper sees through your lies and readies for battle.*

HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush_31.speaker: Player
HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush_31.text: The cult took me prisoner. Thank the gods you came when you did.

HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush_12.speaker: Player
HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush_12.text: I'm not here to explain myself - I just want the lantern. Hand it over, or die.

PAD_BacktrackedToCaravanCheckpoint_0.speaker: Player
PAD_BacktrackedToCaravanCheckpoint_0.text: Looks like the drider's caravan came from here.

PAD_BacktrackedToCaravanCheckpoint_3.speaker: Player
PAD_BacktrackedToCaravanCheckpoint_3.text: They won't be back here any time soon, thanks to us.

PAD_BacktrackedToCaravanCheckpoint_2.speaker: Player
PAD_BacktrackedToCaravanCheckpoint_2.text: Cages, shackles... all prepared to march captives off to their fate.

PAD_BacktrackedToCaravanCheckpoint_5.speaker: Player
PAD_BacktrackedToCaravanCheckpoint_5.text: Looks like the drider's caravan came from here.

PAD_BacktrackedToCaravanCheckpoint_4.speaker: Player
PAD_BacktrackedToCaravanCheckpoint_4.text: They won't be needing this place again.

PAD_BacktrackedToCaravanCheckpoint_1.speaker: Player
PAD_BacktrackedToCaravanCheckpoint_1.text: Cages, shackles... all prepared to march captives off to their fate.

HarperMelee_000_0.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarperMelee_000_0.text: The shadows deepen. Seek light where you can.

HarperMelee_000_1.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarperMelee_000_1.text: Keen your blades, nock your arrows. They know we're here.

HarperMelee_000_2.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarperMelee_000_2.text: Steel yourself, and fight to the last.

HarperMelee_000_6.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarperMelee_000_6.text: I'll be honest - didn't think we stood a chance. Not 'til you came along.

HarperMelee_000_7.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarperMelee_000_7.text: Jaheira's godsend, in the flesh. Pleasure to have you.

HarperMelee_000_8.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarperMelee_000_8.text: Jaheira's waiting for you, is she not?

HarperMelee_000_9.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarperMelee_000_9.text: We expect great things of you.

HarperRanger_001_1.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001_1.text: You're the one Jaheira entrusted to infiltrate Moonrise, aren't you? Gods be with you.

HarperRanger_001_10.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001_10.text: The farther you stray from Last Light, the stronger the curse becomes - and Moonrise is beyond where the shadows are darkest.

HarperRanger_001_13.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001_13.text: You won't survive the journey without protection - and we know where you can find it.

HarperRanger_001_21.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001_21.text: We've been tracking cultists who pass through the shadows unharmed, guided by an uncanny light. We plan to steal it.

HarperRanger_001_23.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001_23.text: With your help, we'll destroy their convoy. Then you can forge a path to the tower, with their light to guide you.

HarperRanger_001_9.speaker: Player
HarperRanger_001_9.text: Let's take them down. You lead, I follow.

HarperRanger_001_3.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001_3.text: Quickly, then. I will mark the rendezvous point, should you lose your way.

HarperRanger_001_19.speaker: Player
HarperRanger_001_19.text: Go on ahead. I'll catch up.

HarperRanger_001_2.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001_2.text: If you insist. I'll mark your map - but waste no more time than is needed. This chance is too precious to miss.

HarperRanger_001_0.speaker: Player
HarperRanger_001_0.text: You're too late - I've encountered the convoy, led by a drider.

HarperRanger_001_11.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001_11.text: A drider? Gods - yet still your heart beats. Most impressive.

HarperRanger_001_8.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001_8.text: For now, then, I can only wait. I eagerly await the next call to battle.

HarperRanger_001_4.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001_4.text: May the road rise to meet you, and the shadows keep at bay.

HarperRanger_001_7.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001_7.text: We will survive. We must survive.

HarperRanger_001_12.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001_12.text: You brought hope, just as we'd lost it. But we're not out of this yet.

HarperRanger_001_14.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001_14.text: We've shared but one victory, friend. But it will not be our last.

HarperRanger_001_15.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001_15.text: At your side until we claim victory, my friend.

HarperRanger_001_17.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001_17.text: 'True Soul', I believe? How fortunate we are, to have you among us.

HarperRanger_001_18.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001_18.text: Let's move - we can't miss our chance to strike the convoy.

HarperRanger_001_22.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001_22.text: We are exposed. With Isobel gone, each of us must rely on the others.

AD_Harper_Ranger_000_0.speaker: Harper Manus
AD_Harper_Ranger_000_0.context: NodeContext: in combat, menacing your enemies

Caravan_GoblinMelee_000_0.speaker: Brawler Vez
Caravan_GoblinMelee_000_0.text: Can we get movin'? Nabbed these boots from a gnome, and they don't bloody fit.

Caravan_GoblinMelee_000_1.speaker: Brawler Vez
Caravan_GoblinMelee_000_1.text: We going or what? Shadows ain't gettin' any friendlier.

CaravanAmbushed_3.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanAmbushed_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Drider raises a hand, bringing the caravan to a stop.

CaravanAmbushed_8.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanAmbushed_8.context: CinematicNodeContext: He raises the lantern, peering into the darkNodeContext: He raises the lantern, peering into the dark

CaravanAmbushed_7.speaker: Harper Branthos
CaravanAmbushed_7.text: Harpers, attack! Kill the cultists - and get that lantern!
CaravanAmbushed_7.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harpers burst from hiding, Charging to attack the caravan

CaravanAmbushed_6.speaker: Harper Manus
CaravanAmbushed_6.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harpers burst from hiding, Charging to attack the caravan

CaravanAmbushed_10.speaker: Harper Skywin
CaravanAmbushed_10.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harpers burst from hiding, Charging to attack the caravan

CaravanAmbushed_1.speaker: Harper Elindale
CaravanAmbushed_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harpers burst from hiding, Charging to attack the caravan

CaravanAmbushed_11.speaker: Narrator
CaravanAmbushed_11.text: *These Harpers are clearly enemies of the Absolute... they could be worthwhile allies. But defend the guide, and you may preserve your cover as a True Soul. *

CaravanAmbushed_9.speaker: Player
CaravanAmbushed_9.text: Defend the caravan, attack the Harpers.

CaravanAmbushed_4.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanAmbushed_4.text: Kill them! Tear the heathens to pieces!

CaravanAmbushed_2.speaker: Player
CaravanAmbushed_2.text: Turn on the caravan and attack the drider.

CaravanAmbushed_0.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanAmbushed_0.text: What are they doing? We thought they were True Souls! Traitors! Heathens!
CaravanAmbushed_0.context: NodeContext: talking about the players, who he had trusted until this point - furious and dismayed

AD_CombatStarts_0.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_CombatStarts_0.text: Drive them into the dark! Do not let them take our light!

AD_HarperTakesMoonlantern_0.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_HarperTakesMoonlantern_0.text: The heretics hold the lantern - take it back!

AD_CaravanConflict_0.speaker: Brawler Vez
AD_CaravanConflict_0.text: You look twitchy, stone-skin. Afraid of the dark?

AD_CaravanConflict_1.speaker: Kansif
AD_CaravanConflict_1.text: In this place? Only a fool wouldn't be.

AD_HarpersAfterAmbush_0.speaker: Harper Branthos
AD_HarpersAfterAmbush_0.text: The cultists will soon know the drider's fallen...

AD_HarpersAfterAmbush_12.speaker: Harper Elindale
AD_HarpersAfterAmbush_12.text: If they come, we fight. That's the way of it.

AD_HarpersAfterAmbush_13.speaker: Harper Manus
AD_HarpersAfterAmbush_13.text: All the more reason to keep our senses keen.

AD_HarpersAfterAmbush_9.speaker: Harper Skywin
AD_HarpersAfterAmbush_9.text: Then we best keep our blades sharp and our torches alight.

AD_HarpersAfterAmbush_3.speaker: Harper Branthos
AD_HarpersAfterAmbush_3.text: Stay on your toes - more cultists might still pass.

AD_HarpersAfterAmbush_7.speaker: Harper Elindale
AD_HarpersAfterAmbush_7.text: Then we'll gut them like the rest.

AD_HarpersAfterAmbush_14.speaker: Harper Manus
AD_HarpersAfterAmbush_14.text: We shouldn't hang about. Jaheira's lost too many as it is.

AD_HarpersAfterAmbush_1.speaker: Harper Skywin
AD_HarpersAfterAmbush_1.text: I say we head to Last Light. There's a wine bottle calling my name.

AD_HarpersAfterAmbush_10.speaker: Harper Branthos
AD_HarpersAfterAmbush_10.text: One less blight in the darkness. A thousand more to conquer.

AD_HarpersAfterAmbush_4.speaker: Harper Manus
AD_HarpersAfterAmbush_4.text: At very least. For every beast we slay, the shadows spawn two more.

AD_HarpersAfterAmbush_11.speaker: Harper Elindale
AD_HarpersAfterAmbush_11.text: Gods - why so glum? We hit the cult where it hurts.

AD_HarpersAfterAmbush_5.speaker: Harper Skywin
AD_HarpersAfterAmbush_5.text: A victory is a victory. Our heads are intact - and that's worth celebrating.

AD_HarpersAfterAmbush_15.speaker: Harper Branthos
AD_HarpersAfterAmbush_15.text: That won't be the last blood we spill.

AD_HarpersAfterAmbush_6.speaker: Harper Elindale
AD_HarpersAfterAmbush_6.text: Damn right it won't. I'll crush every cultist myself if I have to.

AD_HarpersAfterAmbush_2.speaker: Harper Manus
AD_HarpersAfterAmbush_2.text: The Chionthar'll run red, if I have my way.

HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush_0.speaker: Harper Lassandra
HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush_0.text: 'Last Light', indeed. Savour it while you can.

HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush_1.speaker: Harper Lassandra
HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush_1.text: Listen - if you want to reach Moonrise, you're going to need help. And I know where you'll find it.

HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush_19.speaker: Harper Lassandra
HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush_19.text: There's a cultist convoy that passes each day. It carries a lantern that burns the curse away.

HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush_4.speaker: Harper Lassandra
HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush_4.text: You're going to seize that lantern - and I'm going to help you. Just say the word.

HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush_8.speaker: Player
HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush_8.text: Let's take on that convoy. You lead, I follow.

HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush_11.speaker: Harper Lassandra
HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush_11.text: Wonderful. I will mark your map, so you can find us, should you lose the way.

HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush_15.speaker: Player
HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush_15.text: Go on ahead. I'll catch up.

HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush_16.speaker: Harper Lassandra
HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush_16.text: Sure, why not? I'll mark your map.

HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush_10.speaker: Harper Lassandra
HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush_10.text: But don't take long. We must strike while the iron is hot.

HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush_6.speaker: Player
HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush_6.text: You're too late - I've encountered the convoy, led by a drider.

HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush_9.speaker: Harper Lassandra
HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush_9.text: Hells - and you survived? A drider's no joke. Especially in these lands.

HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush_5.speaker: Harper Lassandra
HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush_5.text: I guess you don't need my help after all. Though something tells me I'll be needing yours.

HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush_18.speaker: Harper Lassandra
HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush_18.text: Fair enough. But try not to dally - that lantern's your key to survival.

HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush_2.speaker: Harper Lassandra
HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush_2.text: The shadows are getting bolder. I don't know if we can repel another attack.

HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush_13.speaker: Harper Lassandra
HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush_13.text: Good to see a friendly face.

HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush_14.speaker: Harper Lassandra
HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush_14.text: We're damn near helpless without Isobel. It's only a matter of time now.

HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush_17.speaker: Harper Lassandra
HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush_17.text: All or nothing. That's the bottom line.

HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush_20.speaker: Harper Lassandra
HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush_20.text: If you're to make it to Moonrise, we need to ambush that convoy and take their lantern.

HarperScout_AfterAmbush_1.speaker: Harper Lassandra
HarperScout_AfterAmbush_1.text: Take the lantern off the corpse. I doubt it will mind.

HarperScout_AfterAmbush_2.speaker: Harper Lassandra
HarperScout_AfterAmbush_2.text: Impressive - you've a way with words.

HarperScout_AfterAmbush_3.speaker: Harper Lassandra
HarperScout_AfterAmbush_3.text: A battle I won't soon forget. And in such favoured company, no less.

HarperScout_AfterAmbush_4.speaker: Harper Lassandra
HarperScout_AfterAmbush_4.text: Go ahead, examine the drider. The lantern's there for the taking.

HarperScout_AfterAmbush_5.speaker: Harper Lassandra
HarperScout_AfterAmbush_5.text: Take the lantern off the corpse. I doubt it will mind.

HarperRanger_000_AfterAmbush_0.speaker: Harper Manus
HarperRanger_000_AfterAmbush_0.text: Take the lantern. I doubt that corpse will be fighting back.

HarperRanger_000_AfterAmbush_4.speaker: Harper Manus
HarperRanger_000_AfterAmbush_4.text: Splendid show - newsworthy, even! Where's Volo Geddarm when you need him?

HarperRanger_000_AfterAmbush_1.speaker: Harper Manus
HarperRanger_000_AfterAmbush_1.text: Go on, check the drider. The lantern's yours for the taking.

AD_Harpers_AtInn_AfterAmbush_3.speaker: Harper Branthos
AD_Harpers_AtInn_AfterAmbush_3.text: I know you're keen, Elin. Be patient - your chance will come.

AD_Harpers_AtInn_AfterAmbush_2.speaker: Harper Branthos
AD_Harpers_AtInn_AfterAmbush_2.text: Until then, keep watch, and keep wary. I need your senses sharp.

AD_Harpers_AtInn_AfterAmbush_4.speaker: Harper Elindale
AD_Harpers_AtInn_AfterAmbush_4.text: Take a moment, Bran. Savour our victory over the drider.

AD_Harpers_AtInn_AfterAmbush_20.speaker: Harper Branthos
AD_Harpers_AtInn_AfterAmbush_20.text: I'll celebrate when Ketheric's dead. Not before.

AD_Harpers_AtInn_AfterAmbush_19.speaker: Harper Elindale
AD_Harpers_AtInn_AfterAmbush_19.text: We're still alive, Bran. That's worth a cheer, at the very least.

AD_Harpers_AtInn_AfterAmbush_9.speaker: Harper Branthos
AD_Harpers_AtInn_AfterAmbush_9.text: Have you ever known me to cheer?

AD_Harpers_AtInn_AfterAmbush_7.speaker: Harper Elindale
AD_Harpers_AtInn_AfterAmbush_7.text: There must be something more we can do, Bran.

AD_Harpers_AtInn_AfterAmbush_0.speaker: Harper Branthos
AD_Harpers_AtInn_AfterAmbush_0.text: Then give it time. We will see victory yet.

AD_Harpers_AtInn_AfterAmbush_11.speaker: Harper Elindale
AD_Harpers_AtInn_AfterAmbush_11.text: So now what. We just - wait? Hope the True Soul comes through?

AD_Harpers_AtInn_AfterAmbush_10.speaker: Harper Branthos
AD_Harpers_AtInn_AfterAmbush_10.text: If we're called, we join the fight against Ketheric. And with the True Soul, we will land the final blow.

AD_Harpers_AtInn_AfterAmbush_1.speaker: Harper Elindale
AD_Harpers_AtInn_AfterAmbush_1.text: I just - are you really sure we can trust someone who is infected?

AD_Harpers_AtInn_AfterAmbush_6.speaker: Harper Branthos
AD_Harpers_AtInn_AfterAmbush_6.text: Yes. Until Jaheira gives me reason to think otherwise.

AD_Harpers_AtInn_AfterAmbush_15.speaker: Harper Branthos
AD_Harpers_AtInn_AfterAmbush_15.text: A drider doing the cult's work. The Absolute's claws have dug deep.

AD_Harpers_AtInn_AfterAmbush_16.speaker: Harper Elindale
AD_Harpers_AtInn_AfterAmbush_16.text: Its death was surely a great blow to the cult.

AD_Harpers_AtInn_AfterAmbush_14.speaker: Harper Branthos
AD_Harpers_AtInn_AfterAmbush_14.text: They've gathered an entire army. What's one lost soldier among thousands?

Caravan_HalfOrcMelee_AtTower_0.speaker: Bedi
Caravan_HalfOrcMelee_AtTower_0.text: Her cathedral will stand in the city, True Soul. On the bones of all Baldurians.
Caravan_HalfOrcMelee_AtTower_0.context: NodeContext: grave, taking himself too seriously

Caravan_HalfOrcMelee_AtTower_1.speaker: Bedi
Caravan_HalfOrcMelee_AtTower_1.text: Stink of dead gods and dust. This ruin is scarcely worthy of our Absolute.
Caravan_HalfOrcMelee_AtTower_1.context: NodeContext: snorting, derisive of Moonrise Towers

AtTower_1.speaker: Kar'niss
AtTower_1.text: To think, it was we who brought you to Our Majesty's blessing.
AtTower_1.context: NodeContext: Barely controlled excitement - we're a random acquaintance who basically became a celebrity. He expects a great reward by association,.

AtTower_3.speaker: Kar'niss
AtTower_3.text: Outcast no longer. I will ascend.
AtTower_3.context: NodeContext: More to himself - fervent and not entirely sane

AtTower_4.speaker: Kar'niss
AtTower_4.text: An interloper receives the Majesty's blessing before us?
AtTower_4.context: NodeContext: Looking at us with barely-reined in disgust - he is more deserving thatn we are, surely

AtTower_0.speaker: Kar'niss
AtTower_0.context: NodeContext: Leaning forward with glint of madness - could be take as encouragement or threat

AD_Warning_0.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_Warning_0.text: If they wander, we will not be responsible.

AD_Warning_4.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_Warning_4.text: If they die, it is their own fault.

AD_Warning_2.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_Warning_2.text: They wander away from the light, Majesty.

AD_Warning_3.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_Warning_3.text: Do they know what they're doing?

AD_Warning_5.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_Warning_5.text: They should stay closer, my Queen. They should stay in the light.

AD_Warning_1.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_Warning_1.text: Unless they want to become shadows...

Caravan_GoblinMelee_001_AtTower_0.speaker: Warrior Gronag
Caravan_GoblinMelee_001_AtTower_0.text: Absolute's blessing on ya. Maybe Her design will throw us together again sometime.

Caravan_GoblinMelee_001_AtTower_1.speaker: Warrior Gronag
Caravan_GoblinMelee_001_AtTower_1.text: Look busy if y'can, True Soul. I hear the Disciple ain't long putting idle hands to work.

Harper_Melee_000_AD_LassandraDies_0.speaker: Harper Branthos
Harper_Melee_000_AD_LassandraDies_0.context: NodeContext: Just watched your friend Lassandra die in combat

AD_HarpersReachAmbushHouse_0.speaker: GROUP_Act2_SCL_HarpersAmbush
AD_HarpersReachAmbushHouse_0.text: Perfect spot for an ambush. Get into position.

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_197.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_197.text: Plan's simple: your brain-bug is the bait - they'll trust you. Lure them in, then we hit 'em hard and fast. Once they're down, you grab the lantern.

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_59.speaker: Harper Lassandra
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_59.text: If you can distract them with that tadpole of yours, we can attack from up here. It'll be over before they know it, and then you can collect the lantern.

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_137.speaker: Harper Elindale
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_137.text: Your parasite gives us the element of surprise - let's use it. You lure them in, we cut them down, then you grab the lantern.

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_126.speaker: Harper Manus
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_126.text: The plan's simple: you draw the cultists' attention with your brain-bug, we hit them hard and fast. Once they're down, you grab the lantern.

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_37.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_37.text: The plan is simple - draw them close with your tadpole, we attack from above, and you collect the lantern once they're dead.

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_40.speaker: Kar'niss
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_40.text: We bring more to your church every day, my Queen. Your followers are legion.
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_40.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Drider appears, leading a caravan of Absolute Cultists and prisoners, Moonlantern in his hand. The Caravan is silent, bar the drider muttering quietly to itself.NodeContext: Drider muttering to himself

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_138.speaker: Harper Lassandra
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_138.text: Go! We'll wait for your signal.
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_138.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harpers step back into shadows, leaving players looking down on the ambush location alone

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_24.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_24.text: We'll wait for your signal. Go!
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_24.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harpers step back into shadows, leaving players looking down on the ambush location alone

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_180.speaker: Kar'niss
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_180.text: Your faithful stand ready, Majesty. Soon we march. Soon the world will bow to you.
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_180.context: CinematicNodeContext: Drider and caravan approach, players is looking down on them

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_124.speaker: Brawler Vez
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_124.text: 'Ere, web arse - something moved up there. Want me to drag it out?
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_124.context: CinematicNodeContext: Goblin peering into the darknessNodeContext: Peering into the dark

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_219.speaker: Kar'niss
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_219.text: They stay in the light! They do not go into the dark.

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_189.speaker: Brawler Vez
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_189.text: Didn't figure something as big and ugly as you for a coward.
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_189.context: CinematicNodeContext: Draws sword and moves towards the shadowsNodeContext: Draws sword and moves towards the shadows

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_45.speaker: Brawler Vez
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_45.context: CinematicNodeContext: The DRIDER spins and leaps, knocking the GOBLIN CULTIST to the ground. It's a frenzied, brutal attack.NodeContext: Drider leaps and attacks Vez - knocking him to the ground, beating him. The goblin screams

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_20.speaker: Kar'niss
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_20.text: NO! THEY WILL NOT GO INTO THE DARK!

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_217.speaker: Kar'niss
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_217.text: THEY WILL NOT BECOME SHADOWS! THEY WILL NOT FEED THE CURSE!

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_190.speaker: Kar'niss
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_190.text: Forgive me, my Queen, but I had to. Before the dark got any stronger.
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_190.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The DRIDER pulls back, leaving the mangled corpse of the goblin. The HALF ORC snorts disapproval.

TK : Cinematic Artist note - Hide Actor for Vez in this node.InternalNodeContext: SFX: the half orc snorts.

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_122.speaker: Player
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_122.text: Clear your throat to make yourself known.

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_202.speaker: Narrator
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_202.text: *The drider's eyes cut through the darkness, locking on you as your parasite squirms with excitement.*

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_81.speaker: Player
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_81.text: Try to fade into the background until they pass.

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_62.speaker: Player
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_62.text: Try to blend into the shadows, letting them pass you by.

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_103.speaker: Kar'niss
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_103.text: We will carry your light, Majesty. We are happy to serve...
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_103.context: CinematicNodeContext: Drider walks past where the player is hiding, not noticing them. The caravan is starting to move past the ambush point - the Harpers are about to miss their chance.NodeContext: Muttering to himself

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_84.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_84.text: The hells are you waiting for? Attack!
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_84.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harpers stand up, revealed in the darknessNodeContext: 'Attack!' is an order yelled to his comrades hiding with him

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_123.speaker: Harper Lassandra
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_123.text: What are you waiting for? Attack!
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_123.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harpers stand up, revealed in the darknessNodeContext: first line is to the players. 'Attack!' is an order to the Harpers with her.

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_39.speaker: Harper Elindale
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_39.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harpers stand up, revealed in the darkness

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_101.speaker: Kar'niss
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_101.context: CinematicNodeContext: Drider turns to face the HarpersNodeContext: Surprised, outraged at the appearance of his enemies

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_110.speaker: Harper Manus
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_110.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harpers stand up, revealed in the darknessNodeContext: 'Harpers!' is an order barked at the others hiding there. like "Harpers, attack!"

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_49.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_49.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harpers stand up, revealed in the darkness

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_56.speaker: Kar'niss
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_56.text: Follow close, little ones. Do not leave the light!
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_56.context: NodeContext: Spoken to the other members of the caravan - a warning not to get too close to the dangerous shadows

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_88.context: CinematicNodeContext: Caravan leaves without you engaging with it

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_78.speaker: Narrator
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_78.text: *Your minds connect and you hear a voice whispering to you. The Absolute? Or just the echoes of his fractured mind, reverberating in the darkness?*

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_169.speaker: Kar'niss
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_169.text: One of your True Souls, my Queen! How have they survived?
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_169.context: CinematicNodeContext: Scuttles forward, holding the lantern to illuminate the player's face

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_8.speaker: Kar'niss
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_8.text: You blessed them too, my Queen? Where is their lantern?

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_152.speaker: Player
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_152.text: The Absolute guided me here. She said a mere drider was not worthy - that I must take your lantern.

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_175.speaker: Player
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_175.text: Our wondrous Queen dropped me a message - she said you need to give me that lantern. It's very important.

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_153.speaker: Player
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_153.text: You're holding my lantern. The Absolute said you had to give it to me.

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_115.speaker: Player
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_115.text: The Absolute guided me to you. She said I was to take yours.

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_92.speaker: Player
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_92.text: I would use True Soul Nere's lantern, but it broke.

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_187.speaker: Kar'niss
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_187.text: Nere? A fickle, unworthy servant to our Queen.

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_161.speaker: Kar'niss
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_161.text: Yes, majesty, your light can shield another of your faithful. They will join us on the road.

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_148.speaker: Player
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_148.text: No - that lantern is mine, by order of the Absolute. Give it - now.

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_177.speaker: Player
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_177.text: That lantern is mine - by order of the Absolute. Drop it, or I'll shatter your spine as the wind breaks a twig.

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_0.speaker: Player
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_0.text: That lantern is mine - by order of the Absolute. Drop it, or I'll boil your brain inside your skull.

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_135.speaker: Kar'niss
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_135.text: Majesty? Is - is this true? Did I not serve you well?

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_154.speaker: Kar'niss
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_154.text: Very well. If it is your will, they can have it.
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_154.context: CinematicNodeContext: Drider throws the Moonlantern to the ground in angerNodeContext: Drider throws the Moonlantern to the ground in anger

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_209.speaker: Player
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_209.text: So how does this work, exactly?
