HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_70.speaker: Kar'niss
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_70.text: They don't know? Our Queen told them nothing?

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_156.speaker: Kansif
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_156.text: The lamp's light keeps the shadows at bay. Stops them from getting close enough to grab us.

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_35.speaker: Kar'niss
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_35.text: Silence! The Absolute's favoured are speaking.
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_35.context: CinematicNodeContext: At half-orcNodeContext: Snapping at an insubordinate

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_23.speaker: Kar'niss
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_23.text: She has blessed the lantern's light. It is the Absolute who protects us from the shadows.
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_23.context: NodeContext: Stress on first word. "*She* has blessed this light."

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_96.speaker: Player
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_96.text: Protects us from what? What are the shadows, exactly?

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_79.speaker: Kar'niss
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_79.text: Simply shadows. Cursed, hungry shadows, trying to grab the living. And they are getting stronger.

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_145.speaker: Kar'niss
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_145.text: But do not worry, there is still power in the lantern. Our queen will protect you, as she protected me.

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_127.speaker: Kansif
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_127.text: It's time to go, lantern bearer. The sooner we clear the dark, the better.

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_184.speaker: Player
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_184.text: Indeed, it's time for you to go.

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_113.speaker: Kansif
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_113.text: We can't go without you - the shadows would tear us to pieces.

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_131.speaker: Kar'niss
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_131.text: This is not her Majesty's will.

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_34.speaker: Player
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_34.text: I am both a True Soul and a cleric. I've blessed you with the power of the Absolute - you'll be safe.

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_38.speaker: Player
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_38.text: Securus! There - you now carry the blessing of the Absolute. You'll be safe.

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_36.speaker: Player
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_36.text: Vale, idiotae! There - you now carry the blessing of the Absolute. You'll be safe.

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_4.speaker: Player
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_4.text: (Wave hands.) There - you now carry the blessing of the Absolute. You'll be safe.

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_67.speaker: Player
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_67.text: The Absolute has blessed you. You will be safe.

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_221.speaker: Kar'niss
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_221.text: If - if it is her majesty's will...

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_162.speaker: Kansif
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_162.text: You can't be serious. You know what's out there-

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_208.speaker: Kar'niss
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_208.text: IF IT IS HER MAJESTY'S WILL, THEN WE SHALL WALK!

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_171.speaker: Kar'niss
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_171.text: She will protect us. She - she must.

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_205.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The HALF-ORC shoots you a dirty look, but follows the DRIDER into the darkness, along with the other cultists. There is silence for a beat before screams start to pierce the air. There is sound of a brief battle. 

To account for Vez being dead or alive we will rely on a Show Actor key in Node N858.

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_199.speaker: Kar'niss
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_199.context: CinematicNodeContext: Off screen, cries from the darkness, which fade to an eerie silence.NodeContext: Off screen, being killed by shadow monsters. He cries out, begging his god to save him, but it's too late

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_170.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_170.text: I'd never believe it if I hadn't just seen it. Nicely done!
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_170.context: CinematicNodeContext: Emerging from their hiding place, walking over to player

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_5.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_5.text: Now, let's see what we've got here...

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_41.speaker: Harper Elindale
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_41.text: That was spectacular! I was sure you were dead.
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_41.context: CinematicNodeContext: Emerging from their hiding place, walking over to player

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_218.speaker: Harper Elindale
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_218.text: Happy to be proven wrong, of course. Now, what's this lantern?

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_223.speaker: Harper Lassandra
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_223.text: You are full of surprises, aren't you? Incredible.
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_223.context: CinematicNodeContext: Emerging from their hiding place, walking over to player

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_133.speaker: Harper Lassandra
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_133.text: Now, let's find that lantern, huh?

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_165.speaker: Harper Manus
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_165.context: CinematicNodeContext: Emerging from their hiding place, walking over to player

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_68.speaker: Harper Manus
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_68.text: I almost pity them, walking into all that. But you did what you needed to.

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_172.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_172.context: CinematicNodeContext: Emerging from their hiding place, walking over to player

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_201.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_201.text: And no one can argue with the results.

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_132.speaker: Narrator
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_132.text: *As the sounds fade, there is nothing left but cold, still silence.*

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_203.speaker: Kar'niss
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_203.text: They think us fools, Majesty. They think we cannot see through their lies.

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_100.speaker: Kar'niss
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_100.text: We will punish them for this blasphemy. We will make them scream!

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_75.speaker: Player
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_75.text: The Absolute wants you to go. Now!

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_114.speaker: Player
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_114.text: Question me again, and I will drag you into the darkness - screaming.

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_106.speaker: Player
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_106.text: If we were in the Underdark, I would split you open, drider. Leave before I change my mind.

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_54.speaker: Player
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_54.text: I know dangerous terrains - you'll be fine if you stick to the path. Trust me.

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_150.speaker: Kar'niss
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_150.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harpers reveal themselvesNodeContext: Surprised, outraged at the appearance of his enemies

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_134.speaker: Kar'niss
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_134.text: But majesty, you gave this lantern to me. You said it was mine!

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_14.speaker: Kar'niss
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_14.text: No, we will keep your gift and drive this false one back into the dark!

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_86.speaker: Player
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_86.text: The Absolute has asked me to carry the lantern. Hand it over.

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_213.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_213.text: The hells are you doing? Attack!
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_213.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harpers stand up, revealed in the darknessNodeContext: 'Attack!' is an order yelled to his comrades hiding with him

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_9.speaker: Harper Lassandra
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_9.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harpers stand up, revealed in the darknessNodeContext: 'Attack!' is an order to her comrades hiding with her

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_107.speaker: Kar'niss
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_107.context: CinematicNodeContext: Drider turns to face the HarpersNodeContext: Surprised, outraged at the appearance of his enemies

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_191.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_191.text: We can't let you leave. Harpers - now!
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_191.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harpers stand up, revealed in the darknessNodeContext: 'Harpers - now!' is an order yelled to his comrades hiding with him

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_82.speaker: Harper Elindale
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_82.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harpers stand up, revealed in the darkness

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_185.speaker: Harper Manus
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_185.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harpers stand up, revealed in the darknessNodeContext: 'Harpers!' is an order barked at the others hiding there. like "Harpers, attack!"

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_60.speaker: Kar'niss
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_60.text: They will follow close. Do not leave the light!
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_60.context: CinematicNodeContext: Drider turns and starts to leave, ready to head into the dark. You're expected to follow.

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_72.speaker: Player
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_72.text: Or I could kill you and take that light.

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_51.speaker: Player
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_51.text: Lantern? Is that what protects you out here?

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_193.speaker: Kar'niss
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_193.text: Our goddess protects us. We carry her sacred light to drive back the shadows.
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_193.context: NodeContext: 'Sacred light' referring to the Moonlantern

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_195.speaker: Player
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_195.text: Never mind me, how have you survived the curse?

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_55.speaker: Player
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_55.text: Never mind that, there's a gang of Harpers ready to ambush you.

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_168.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_168.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harpers stand up, revealed in the darknessNodeContext: Player just betrayed you and ratted you out

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_160.speaker: Harper Lassandra
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_160.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harpers stand up, revealed in the darknessNodeContext: Player just betrayed you and ratted you out

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_149.speaker: Harper Elindale
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_149.text: What? Have you lost your mind?!
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_149.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harpers stand up, revealed in the darknessNodeContext: Player just betrayed you and ratted you out

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_91.speaker: Harper Manus
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_91.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harpers stand up, revealed in the darknessNodeContext: Player just betrayed you and ratted you out

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_158.speaker: Kar'niss
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_158.text: To arms! Strike down the heretics!

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_186.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_186.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harpers stand up, revealed in the darknessNodeContext: Player just betrayed you and ratted you out

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_214.speaker: Kar'niss
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_214.text: To have a rage so fierce the dark quivers - you must have blessed them, my Queen! But if so... where is their lantern?

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_25.speaker: Player
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_25.text: I am not one of hers - divine light guides my footfall.

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_116.speaker: Kar'niss
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_116.text: There is but one god - and she is Absolute.

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_215.speaker: Player
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_215.text: Takes more than shadows to put someone like me down.

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_10.speaker: Player
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_10.text: I have tested my mind and body beyond to its absolute limits - I do not fear the darkness.

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_15.speaker: Kar'niss
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_15.text: A mere mortal warrior could have never persevered alone... Ah! Of course!

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_99.speaker: Player
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_99.text: With the aid of my mind and my magic, for I am a master of both.

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_182.speaker: Kar'niss
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_182.text: Magic alone could never have persevered... Ah! Of course!

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_204.speaker: Player
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_204.text: I swore an oath - a powerful one. It will take more than darkness to end me.

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_129.speaker: Kar'niss
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_129.text: Ah, you swore an oath to my Queen! But if so... where is their lantern?

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_12.speaker: Player
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_12.text: No higher forces protect me - I survived by my own tenacity.

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_94.speaker: Player
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_94.text: I am a guardian of nature - and in return nature protects me.

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_64.speaker: Kar'niss
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_64.text: But the druids have no power here, not since... Ah, of course!

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_178.speaker: Player
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_178.text: You know what they say - a ballad a day, keeps the darkness away!

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_19.speaker: Kar'niss
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_19.text: To make the darkness quiver with mere song - you must have blessed them, my Queen. But if so... where is their lantern?

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_97.speaker: Player
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_97.text: Navigating dangerous terrain is second nature to me.

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_139.speaker: Player
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_139.text: I burn with pure arcana - how on earth do you survive?

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_211.speaker: Narrator
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_211.text: *Your minds connect and before you can stop him, the drider is inside your head - scrabbling through your secrets.*

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_198.speaker: Kar'niss
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_198.text: Heretics in the dark! Kill them - destroy the blasphemers!
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_198.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player and Harpers emerge to attack the caravan

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_147.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player signals the hapers to attack

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_102.speaker: Player
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_102.text: Emerge from the shadows and attack!

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_87.speaker: Kar'niss
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_87.context: CinematicNodeContext: Drider turns to the player as we emerge from the shadows. Drider assumes a battle/aggressive stance and is clearly ready to fight.

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_181.speaker: Player
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_181.text: Try to hide and let the caravan pass unchallenged.

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_141.speaker: Player
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_141.text: Try to blend into the shadows, letting the caravan pass unchallenged.

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_117.speaker: Harper Elindale
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_117.text: Into position. We'll follow your lead.
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_117.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harpers step back into shadows, leaving players looking down on the ambush location alone

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_159.speaker: Harper Manus
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_159.text: Quickly - we'll wait for your signal.
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_159.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harpers step back into shadows, leaving players looking down on the ambush location alone

HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_128.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_128.text: Go. Signal us when you're ready.
HarpersAndPlayersAmbush_128.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harpers step back into shadows, leaving players looking down on the ambush location alone

HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_0.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_0.text: Victory is ours - alas, not without consequence.

HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_56.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_56.text: Examine the corpse. The lantern is yours to take.

HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_6.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_6.text: Our objectives complete without drawing a weapon. Incredible work.

HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_26.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_26.text: Well played, you have a gift for cunning. Take the lantern - you earned it.

HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_31.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_31.text: Go on - take the lantern from the corpse.

HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_94.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harper lifts lantern into the air. Its glow illuminates his face,

HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_64.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_64.text: Incredible. A light that chases away even the deepest shadows.
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_64.context: CinematicNodeContext: Musing, not really said to player.

HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_21.speaker: Narrator
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_21.text: *The lantern flickers ever so briefly, and you hear a slight twitter - or perhaps it's simply your imagination.*
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_21.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera shows lantern in Harper's hand. The light flickers just a little, and you hear a little titter come from it. Harper stows the lantern.

HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_74.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player lifts lantern and illuminates their face.

HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_12.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_12.text: Incredible. A light that chases away even the deepest shadows.
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_12.context: CinematicNodeContext: Musing, not really said to player.

HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_83.speaker: Narrator
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_83.text: *The lantern flickers ever so briefly, and you hear a slight twitter - or perhaps it's simply your imagination.*
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_83.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera shows lantern in player's hand. The light flickers just a little, and you hear a little titter come from it. Player stows the lantern.

HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_86.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_86.text: You. Don't move a godsdamned muscle.
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_86.context: CinematicNodeContext:  Addressed to player. Harper raises bow and points at the player.

HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_18.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_18.text: Talk. Why in the hells would a cultist turn on their kind?

HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_71.speaker: Narrator
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_71.text: *You notice a pin on the woman's chest, identical to the one you found in Grymforge. She is a Harper.*
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_71.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera shows the Harper's garb. We see a Harper pin on their chest.

HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_81.speaker: Narrator
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_81.text: *The pin the woman wears is familiar to you. She belongs to the Harpers, a covert organisation dedicated to freedom and balance.*
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_81.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera shows the Harper's garb. We see a Harper pin on their chest.

HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_58.speaker: Player
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_58.text: I'm not one of them. They took me prisoner.

HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_69.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_69.text: A prisoner? Of course - and you would not be the first.
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_69.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harper lowers bow while speaking.

HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_50.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_50.text: Breathe easy, then - you are a captive no longer.

HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_2.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_2.text: Give me the lantern. You must come to Last Light.

HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_53.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_53.text: An inn, at first glance - but also a safe haven, free from the curse's tendrils, or so it's been promised.

HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_70.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_70.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player hands lantern to Harper, who takes it and puts it in inventory. Fine to show only basic upper-body motions.

HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_41.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_41.text: Stay close, and be wary of the shadows. I'll mark your map, should the way be lost.

HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_27.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_27.text: What is this? A cultist after all, then - vermin for crushing.

HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_44.speaker: Player
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_44.text: Sorry. I don't have it anymore.

HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_67.speaker: Player
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_67.text: How about I just kill you and keep the lantern for myself?

HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_62.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_62.text: Another wretch among many. And another kill for my list.

HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_73.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_73.text: You must rest. Come - I will take you to Last Light.

HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_57.speaker: Player
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_57.text: I will make my way there in my own time.

HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_75.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_75.text: Then permit me to mark your map. We will await, for when you are at your most weary.

HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_91.speaker: Player
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_91.text: My goddess protects me. I'll find my own way there.

HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_29.speaker: Player
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_29.text: I couldn't bear the atrocities committed in the Absolute's name.

HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_47.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_47.text: Of which there have been many, I assure you. I am glad you've broken free.
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_47.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harper lowers bow while speaking.

HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_5.speaker: Player
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_5.text: I'm infected with their parasite, but I'm seeking a cure.

HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_77.speaker: Player
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_77.text: I succumbed to their temptations. You gave me an opportunity to escape.

HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_15.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_15.text: A cultist deserter? By the gods.
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_15.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harper lowers bow while speaking.

HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_52.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_52.text: Then it's time you shed your bonds and joined a righteous cause.

HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_1.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_1.text: A face I once trusted, now allied with the shadows' most favoured.
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_1.context: CinematicNodeContext:  Addressed to player. Harper raises bow and points at the player.NodeContext: Very suspicious

HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_60.speaker: Player
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_60.text: I meant to infiltrate the cult. You've ruined the mission.

HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_24.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_24.text: Apologies - I had no word of this mission. Take comfort in knowing there will many more yet.
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_24.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harper lowers bow while speaking.

HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_8.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_8.text: Here - Jaheira insists you take the lantern. It will guide you safely to Moonrise Towers.
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_8.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harper hands player the Moonlantern

HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_76.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_76.text: But it will not slay the creatures that emerge from the darkness. Be vigilant 'til the last.

HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_40.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_40.text: Keep the lantern - Jaheira insisted. It will guide you safely to Moonrise Towers.

HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_90.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_90.text: A lie, clear as the Chionthar's waters. And for that, you will bleed.

HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_19.speaker: Player
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_19.text: The cult took me prisoner. Thank the gods you came when you did.

HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_43.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_43.text: I've merely heeded my calling, friend.
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_43.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harper lowers bow while speaking.

HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_32.speaker: Player
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush_32.text: I'm not here to explain myself - I just want the lantern. Hand it over, or die.

AD_ArriveToTollHouse_1.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_ArriveToTollHouse_1.text: Stay close. The shadows are darkest here - hungriest here.
AD_ArriveToTollHouse_1.context: NodeContext: Warning the others in your caravan - you're entering a very dangerous area.

AD_ArriveToTollHouse_0.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_ArriveToTollHouse_0.text: Do not stray from the light, no matter what they promise you.
AD_ArriveToTollHouse_0.context: NodeContext: Warning the others in your caravan - you're entering a very dangerous area.

Caravan_AD_HalfOrcAndGoblinAtCheckpoint_.speaker: Kansif
Caravan_AD_HalfOrcAndGoblinAtCheckpoint_.text: Don't you believe the Absolute will protect you? Or is your faith waning?

Caravan_AD_HalfOrcAndGoblinAtCheckpoint_.speaker: Sharp-Eye Lora
Caravan_AD_HalfOrcAndGoblinAtCheckpoint_.text: I got faith. I just got common sense too.

Caravan_AD_HalfOrcAndGoblinAtCheckpoint_.speaker: Kansif
Caravan_AD_HalfOrcAndGoblinAtCheckpoint_.text: The guide will see us through the darkness.

Caravan_AD_HalfOrcAndGoblinAtCheckpoint_.speaker: Sharp-Eye Lora
Caravan_AD_HalfOrcAndGoblinAtCheckpoint_.text: Wish he'd bloody well hurry up then. I could swear the shadows are getting closer.

Caravan_AD_HalfOrcAndGoblinAtCheckpoint_.speaker: Sharp-Eye Lora
Caravan_AD_HalfOrcAndGoblinAtCheckpoint_.text: And you ain't? You know what's out there as well as I do.

Caravan_GoblinRanger_0.speaker: Sharp-Eye Lora
Caravan_GoblinRanger_0.text: I miss the camp. It's too quiet out here.

Caravan_GoblinMelee_000_AtTower_0.speaker: Brawler Vez
Caravan_GoblinMelee_000_AtTower_0.text: Wish we was assigned to the war camp. Beer's surely better down there.

Caravan_GoblinMelee_000_AtTower_1.speaker: Brawler Vez
Caravan_GoblinMelee_000_AtTower_1.text: We scratch our arses down 'ere while that leggy freak gets rewarded above? 'S bollocks.

AD_BeforeAmbush_2.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_BeforeAmbush_2.text: They must keep up. The shadows are hungry.

AD_BeforeAmbush_1.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_BeforeAmbush_1.text: ...Patience, Majesty. You bless us with patience.
AD_BeforeAmbush_1.context: NodeContext: Taking a breath to stop from lashing out

CaravanStart_122.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart_122.text: Apart from a torturer of lyres.

CaravanStart_49.speaker: Kansif
CaravanStart_49.text: More faithful of the Absolute. They need a guide to the Tower, same as us.

CaravanStart_124.speaker: Narrator
CaravanStart_124.text: *Your minds connect and you hear a whispered voice. The Absolute? Or just the echoes of his fractured mind, reverberating in the dark?*
CaravanStart_124.context: CinematicNodeContext: The drider scuttles closer to players, looming over them as their minds meld.

CaravanStart_130.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart_130.text: A True Soul. You have more worshippers every day, majesty.

CaravanStart_82.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart_82.context:
CinematicNodeContext: He lowers his face to look the players in the eyes before the line.

Scuttles back to standard distance at the end of the line.NodeContext: He lowers his face to look the players in the eyes. Stress on 'nicely'

CaravanStart_117.speaker: Lae'zel
CaravanStart_117.text: Every step into the darkness leads us away from the crèche. Cleansing awaits - do not lose sight of our prize.

CaravanStart_8.speaker: Lae'zel
CaravanStart_8.text: Every step into the darkness leads us away from the crèche. Do not lose sight of our prize.

CaravanStart_60.speaker: Player
CaravanStart_60.text: It's time to leave. Take me to Moonrise.

CaravanStart_134.speaker: Player
CaravanStart_134.text: So you're the guide? How do you survive out there?

CaravanStart_79.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart_79.text: We have our queen's favour. She speaks to us. Protects us. Graces us with Her blessing.

CaravanStart_154.speaker: Player
CaravanStart_154.text: Why do I need you to get to Moonrise? What's out there?

CaravanStart_145.speaker: Player
CaravanStart_145.text: I'll get to Moonrise myself. A few shadows don't scare me.

CaravanStart_32.speaker: Player
CaravanStart_32.text: I'm not following this damned creature - it's an insult to my Queen!

CaravanStart_31.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart_31.text: Their queen?! They still follow the spider bitch?

CaravanStart_115.speaker: Player
CaravanStart_115.text: Forgive me, obviously I'm loyal to the Absolute.

CaravanStart_110.speaker: Player
CaravanStart_110.text: I follow Lolth almighty, and how dare you reject our Dark Mother.

CaravanStart_64.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart_64.context: NodeContext: Realising you're a traitor and don't believe in his god. Next line is "Treachery! Heathens!"

CaravanStart_136.speaker: Player
CaravanStart_136.text: My, what a delightful abomination you are.

CaravanStart_77.speaker: Player
CaravanStart_77.text: I'm not following that abomination anywhere.

CaravanStart_133.speaker: Brawler Vez
CaravanStart_133.text: Try not to piss him off, mate...

CaravanStart_87.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart_87.text: To insult me is to insult Her Majesty. It is to mock the Absolute!

CaravanStart_167.speaker: Player
CaravanStart_167.text: It's a compliment! You're a beautiful beast. Calm down.

CaravanStart_120.speaker: Player
CaravanStart_120.text: Forgive me, I would never insult the Absolute.

CaravanStart_55.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart_55.text: Do not! It is only Her mercy that keeps us safe in the darkness.

CaravanStart_69.speaker: Player
CaravanStart_69.text: Worshipping the Absolute doesn't stop me finding you disgusting to look at.

CaravanStart_35.speaker: Player
CaravanStart_35.text: Worshipping the Absolute doesn't mean I have to accept freaks like you.

CaravanStart_74.speaker: Brawler Vez
CaravanStart_74.text: Easy now, we're all on the same side, right?

CaravanStart_155.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart_155.text: My queen has ordered me to guide Her followers through the dark. However imperfect they may be.

CaravanStart_5.speaker: Player
CaravanStart_5.text: My apologies. I'm loyal to the Absolute, always.

CaravanStart_43.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart_43.text: Good. It is only Her mercy that keeps us safe in the darkness.

CaravanStart_62.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart_62.text: They are jealous of Your gift, Majesty. But You gave it to us. And we always keep it close.

CaravanStart_38.speaker: Player
CaravanStart_38.text: Why? What's hiding in the dark?

CaravanStart_66.speaker: Player
CaravanStart_66.text: I don't need you to keep me safe out there.

CaravanStart_105.speaker: Player
CaravanStart_105.text: Can I examine your lantern? Surely the Absolute wouldn't mind?

CaravanStart_13.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart_13.text: No! Our queen gave it to us.

CaravanStart_30.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart_30.text: If they wish to walk through the darkness alone, they are welcome to.

CaravanStart_1.speaker: Player
CaravanStart_1.text: Why are you smiling like that? What's out there?

CaravanStart_158.speaker: Brawler Vez
CaravanStart_158.text: Oh ho, the drow really told you nothin', eh?

CaravanStart_111.speaker: Brawler Vez
CaravanStart_111.context: NodeContext: Wants to demonstrate something gross to the player (killing a worg)

CaravanStart_86.speaker: Kansif
CaravanStart_86.text: No more 'demonstrations'. Time is short, we need to go.

CaravanStart_127.context: CinematicNodeContext: The goblin picks up a bone, gets the attention of a nearby hyena, and then throws the bone into the shadows. The hyena chases after it, disappearing into the dark. In the darkness, shadowy tendrils grab the animal. It's dragged  away yelping, until it's silenced with a *crunch*.

CaravanStart_33.speaker: Brawler Vez
CaravanStart_33.text: Don't worry, we didn't need that 'un anyway.

CaravanStart_103.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart_103.text: No no NO! We do not toy with the dark. WE DO NOT FEED THE SHADOWS!
CaravanStart_103.context: CinematicNodeContext: Drider attacks goblin in a frenzy

CaravanStart_95.speaker: Player
CaravanStart_95.text: Admire the grace of the Drider's serrated legs.

CaravanStart_70.speaker: Player
CaravanStart_70.text: Stop ogling the butcher: save the goblin.

CaravanStart_138.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart_138.context: CinematicNodeContext: Drider relents, stops hitting the goblin

CaravanStart_57.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart_57.text: We do not toy with the dark. None of us! Do they understand?
CaravanStart_57.context: CinematicNodeContext: Drider steps away, the goblin is alive and getting up.

CaravanStart_80.speaker: Kansif
CaravanStart_80.text: We understand. Now, we need to go.
CaravanStart_80.context: NodeContext: Stressing 'we need to go' - you're in a rush, but can't order this guy around.

CaravanStart_50.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart_50.text: Yes. Yes, we shall go. Your light leads the way, my Queen. Are all ready?

CaravanStart_19.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart_19.text: Bless us again, Majesty. Shine Your light, protect us.

CaravanStart_6.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart_6.text: Come. Follow and stay close. Do not leave the light. Do not feed the shadows.

CaravanStart_0.speaker: Kansif
CaravanStart_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Yelled at the camp in generalNodeContext: Calling to the goblins around him

CaravanStart_97.speaker: Player
CaravanStart_97.text: That was amazing... Let's travel together.

CaravanStart_68.speaker: Player
CaravanStart_68.text: I'll find another way to Moonrise.

CaravanStart_109.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart_109.text: Die alone, then. We do not care.

CaravanStart_18.speaker: Player
CaravanStart_18.text: You go ahead. I need to consider my options.

CaravanStart_85.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart_85.text: Come. Do not leave the light. Do not feed the shadows.

CaravanStart_146.speaker: Player
CaravanStart_146.text: What the hells is hiding in there?

CaravanStart_93.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart_93.text: Things best avoided. Shadows lurking in shadows.

CaravanStart_139.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart_139.text: Now, will they follow or stay?

CaravanStart_16.speaker: Narrator
CaravanStart_16.text: *You might as well give orders to an avalanche - the drider does not relent.*
CaravanStart_16.context: CinematicNodeContext: Goblin has been beaten to death

CaravanStart_119.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart_119.text: We do not toy with the dark! Do they understand?
CaravanStart_119.context: CinematicNodeContext: Drider steps away, the goblin is deadNodeContext: Panting. You just beat someone to death.

CaravanStart_165.speaker: Brawler Vez
CaravanStart_165.text: Gods above, what's wrong with you?!
CaravanStart_165.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player pulls the goblin away from the drider's attackNodeContext: Recovering from the drider's attack

CaravanStart_160.speaker: Narrator
CaravanStart_160.text: *You try to pull the goblin away, but it's too late. She's gone.*
CaravanStart_160.context: CinematicNodeContext: Goblin has been beaten to death

CaravanStart_27.speaker: Kansif
CaravanStart_27.context: CinematicNodeContext: Drider steps away, but the goblin is deadNodeContext: Shouting to stop someone from beating someone else to death.

CaravanStart_161.speaker: Player
CaravanStart_161.text: Fine. I don't need you or your lamp.

CaravanStart_147.speaker: Brawler Vez
CaravanStart_147.text: That so? Maybe this'll change your mind.
CaravanStart_147.context: NodeContext: Wants to demonstrate something gross to the player (killing a worg)

CaravanStart_58.speaker: Player
CaravanStart_58.text: I apologise, I didn't mean any offence.

CaravanStart_63.speaker: Kansif
CaravanStart_63.text: Good. Now, are we ready to depart?

CaravanStart_104.speaker: Kansif
CaravanStart_104.text: Peace! We have enemies enough out there.

CaravanStart_20.speaker: Player
CaravanStart_20.text: I need to do something first. You wait here.

CaravanStart_11.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart_11.context: CinematicNodeContext: He lowers his face to look the players in the eyesNodeContext: He lowers his face to look the players in the eyes. Stress on 'nicely'

CaravanStart_94.speaker: Kansif
CaravanStart_94.text: More faithful of the Absolute. They need a guide to the Tower, same as us.

CaravanStart_135.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart_135.text: Are they ready, majesty? Shall we depart?

CaravanStart_153.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart_153.text: Your worshippers, Majesty. What happened here?
CaravanStart_153.context: CinematicNodeContext: Drider arrives to find the camp deserted apart from you and some dead goblins.InternalNodeContext: Drider arrives to find the camp has been slaughteredNodeContext: Looking around at dead goblins - his allies have been slaughtered

CaravanStart_56.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart_56.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns and looks at the player with malevolenceNodeContext: Turns and looks at the player with malevolence

CaravanStart_100.speaker: Player
CaravanStart_100.text: I just found them like this.

CaravanStart_91.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart_91.text: At least these have survived. At least we return with some faithful.

CaravanStart_17.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart_17.text: But we should depart. Are they ready to leave?
CaravanStart_17.context: NodeContext: Looks out to the dark, then back to players

CaravanStart_53.speaker: Lae'zel
CaravanStart_53.text: Every step into the darkness leads us away from the crèche. Cleansing awaits - do not lose sight of our prize.

CaravanStart_114.speaker: Player
CaravanStart_114.text: First tell me how you can move safely through the darkness.

CaravanStart_9.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart_9.text: We walk in the Absolute's light. Her blessed power keeps the shadows back.
CaravanStart_9.context: CinematicNodeContext: Drider stares at the moon lantern while delivering line.

CaravanStart_102.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart_102.text: But the shadows are cunning. Wily. If you stray from the light even for a moment, they'll have you.

CaravanStart_75.speaker: Player
CaravanStart_75.text: What's out there? What makes the shadows so dangerous?

CaravanStart_51.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart_51.text: Hungry shades and cursed darkness. Cursed by a lesser god, but dangerous all the same, oh yes.

CaravanStart_112.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart_112.text: Our queen's light will keep them at bay. Will keep us safe as we guide Her faithful to Her temple, but only if they stay close.

CaravanStart_101.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart_101.text: So why are we still waiting, Majesty? Why have we not left?

CaravanStart_162.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart_162.text: They must follow close, Majesty. They must not leave the light.

CaravanStart_107.speaker: Player
CaravanStart_107.text: I need to do something first. You wait here.

CaravanStart_72.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart_72.text: We will wait for a time, Majesty, but not long. The shadows are getting closer - we cannot wait long.

CaravanStart_125.speaker: Lae'zel
CaravanStart_125.text: Every step into the darkness leads us away from the crèche. Do not lose sight of our prize.

CaravanStart_157.speaker: Player
CaravanStart_157.text: I don't know. I was fast asleep, resting for the journey!

CaravanStart_128.speaker: Player
CaravanStart_128.text: I killed them in the Absolute's name, now take me to Moonrise or meet the same fate.

CaravanStart_118.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart_118.text: They culled the weakest of your flock in your name, Majesty. Glorious!
CaravanStart_118.context: CinematicNodeContext: speaking to 'god' rather than the playerNodeContext: rejoicing

CaravanStart_21.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart_21.text: They think they can lie to us, Majesty, but we know better.

CaravanStart_44.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart_44.text: They will pay for this. They will die for this!
CaravanStart_44.context: CinematicNodeContext: Preparing to attack the playerNodeContext: About to attack the player

CaravanStart_150.speaker: Player
CaravanStart_150.text: I slaughtered them, like I'm going to slaughter you.

CaravanStart_47.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart_47.text: No, they will not leave! They will answer for their crimes!
CaravanStart_47.context: CinematicNodeContext: Makes a move to stop the players from leaving before going into combat

HarperCaster_000_0.speaker: Harper Elindale
HarperCaster_000_0.text: I'm ready - I think. Am I? Yes.

HarperCaster_000_1.speaker: Harper Elindale
HarperCaster_000_1.text: You will fight with us won't you?

HarperCaster_000_3.speaker: Harper Elindale
HarperCaster_000_3.text: You were something else, out in the shadows. Won't forget it, that's for damn sure.

HarperCaster_000_4.speaker: Harper Elindale
HarperCaster_000_4.text: Join us, and we'll take that convoy down. It's the only way to survive the curse.

HarperCaster_000_5.speaker: Harper Elindale
HarperCaster_000_5.text: We survived one attack. I don't know if we can survive another.

HarperCaster_000_10.speaker: Harper Elindale
HarperCaster_000_10.text: Jaheira says wait. So we wait.

HarperCaster_000_11.speaker: Harper Elindale
HarperCaster_000_11.text: It's all up to you, chum. But no pressure.

HarperCaster_000_13.speaker: Harper Elindale
HarperCaster_000_13.text: Reckon you're our last hope. But can't say I'm worried.

HarperCaster_000_16.speaker: Harper Elindale
HarperCaster_000_16.text: I'll miss that magic wall. But no Isobel - no protection.

HarperCaster_000_20.speaker: Harper Elindale
HarperCaster_000_20.text: Take a stroll, have a drink. Enjoy them while you can.

HarperCaster_000_24.speaker: Harper Elindale
HarperCaster_000_24.text: Heard you're planning to infiltrate Moonrise, and take the fight to Ketheric. That'd be a tale for the ages.

HarperCaster_000_18.speaker: Harper Elindale
HarperCaster_000_18.text: But the curse is at its strongest between here and there. You won't even reach the tower unless you can survive the darkest shadows.

HarperCaster_000_14.speaker: Harper Elindale
HarperCaster_000_14.text: There's a cultist convoy that brings supplies and personnel to the tower - by some strange magic, they move through the curse unharmed.

HarperCaster_000_25.speaker: Harper Elindale
HarperCaster_000_25.text: With your help, we'll ambush them, and seize their secret. When we do, it's yours, and the path to Moonrise will be open.

HarperCaster_000_23.speaker: Player
HarperCaster_000_23.text: Let's do it. You lead, I follow.

HarperCaster_000_2.speaker: Harper Elindale
HarperCaster_000_2.text: You got it, chum. I'll mark your map, in case you get lost.

HarperCaster_000_8.speaker: Harper Elindale
HarperCaster_000_8.text: But - try not to get lost. Frightful weather out there.
HarperCaster_000_8.context: NodeContext: A little cheeky. The cursed shadows could kill you!

HarperCaster_000_9.speaker: Player
HarperCaster_000_9.text: Go on ahead. I'll catch up.

HarperCaster_000_21.speaker: Harper Elindale
HarperCaster_000_21.text: You got it. Here - I'll mark your map. But don't keep me waiting.

HarperCaster_000_7.speaker: Player
HarperCaster_000_7.text: You're too late - I've encountered the convoy, led by a drider.

HarperCaster_000_17.speaker: Harper Elindale
HarperCaster_000_17.text: Damn. You're lucky to be in one piece.

HarperCaster_000_12.speaker: Harper Elindale
HarperCaster_000_12.text: It's all up to you, then. Do us proud.

HarperCaster_000_6.speaker: Harper Elindale
HarperCaster_000_6.text: All right. But hurry it along, yeah?

AD_AllHarpersWaitingAtAmbush_2.speaker: Harper Branthos
AD_AllHarpersWaitingAtAmbush_2.text: All right. You ready for this?

Caravan_GoblinMelee_001_1.speaker: Warrior Gronag
Caravan_GoblinMelee_001_1.text: What part of 'piss off' weren't clear?

Harper_Melee_000_AD_PlayerTookLantern_0.speaker: Harper Branthos
Harper_Melee_000_AD_PlayerTookLantern_0.text: The cultist has the lantern - take them out!
Harper_Melee_000_AD_PlayerTookLantern_0.context: InternalNodeContext: 'the cultist' and 'them' both refer to the player - could be any gender

Dead_20.speaker: Narrator
Dead_20.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

Dead_10.speaker: Kar'niss
Dead_10.text: Shepherding... the faithful... carrying... our Lady's light...

Dead_4.speaker: Player
Dead_4.text: You walk the shadows safely. How?

Dead_26.speaker: Player
Dead_26.text: How did you trap that pixie in the lantern?

Dead_15.speaker: Kar'niss
Dead_15.text: Always... many voices... hers... the LOUDEST...
Dead_15.context: NodeContext: Even dead, the drider finds the pixie irritating - louder even than the voices in his head

Dead_6.speaker: Player
Dead_6.text: How did the shadow curse come to be?

Dead_5.speaker: Narrator
Dead_5.text: *The corpse remains silent. It does not know.*

Dead_25.speaker: Narrator
Dead_25.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

Dead_28.speaker: Narrator
Dead_28.text: *The corpse seems willing to speak - but not to its killer.*

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_80.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player lifts lantern and illuminates their face.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_3.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_3.text: Incredible. A light so radiant, not even the curse can dim it.
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Musing, not really said to player.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_2.speaker: Narrator
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_2.text: *The lantern flickers ever so briefly, and you hear a slight twitter - or perhaps it's simply your imagination.*
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera shows lantern in player's hand. The light flickers just a little, and you hear a little titter come from it. Player stows the lantern.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_25.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_25.text: You. Don't move a godsdamned muscle.
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_25.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to player. Harper raises his blade and points at the player.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_47.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_47.text: Talk. Why in the hells would a cultist turn on their kind?

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_16.speaker: Narrator
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_16.text: *You notice a pin on the man's chest, identical to the one you found in Grymforge. He is a Harper.*

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_23.speaker: Narrator
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_23.text: *The pin the man wears is familiar to you. He belongs to the Harpers, a covert organisation dedicated to freedom and balance.*
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_23.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera shows the Harper's garb. We see a Harper pin on their chest.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_86.speaker: Player
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_86.text: I'm not one of them. They took me prisoner.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_5.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_5.text: A prisoner? Then I must be a welcome sight indeed.
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harper lowers blade while speaking.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_79.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_79.text: Give me the lantern, and follow. I know a refuge from the darkness. You can rest there.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_83.speaker: Player
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_83.text: What sort of refuge do you mean?

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_52.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_52.text: An inn - Last Light, it's called. A place you can sigh without the shadow-beasts hearing.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_77.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_77.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player hands lantern to Harper, who takes it and puts it in inventory. Fine to show only basic upper-body motions.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_74.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_74.text: Let the lantern's light be your guide. I'll mark your map, should you lose the way.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_42.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_42.text: No lantern? Damnable cultist. Only a fool would play your bloody games.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_45.speaker: Player
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_45.text: Sorry. I don't have it anymore.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_46.speaker: Player
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_46.text: How about I just kill you and keep the lantern for myself?

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_15.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_15.text: Follow me. I know a refuge from the darkness. You can rest there.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_61.speaker: Player
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_61.text: I will make my way there in my own time.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_56.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_56.text: A dangerous choice - but yours to make. I will mark your map.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_11.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_11.text: But don't linger for long. The shadows are not known to take pity.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_65.speaker: Player
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_65.text: My goddess protects me. I'll make my own way there.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_78.speaker: Player
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_78.text: I couldn't bear the atrocities committed in the Absolute's name.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_34.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_34.text: By the Nine Hells, is that right? Then you are quite the curiosity.
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_34.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harper lowers blade while speaking.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_87.speaker: Player
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_87.text: I succumbed to their temptations. You gave me an opportunity to escape.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_9.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_9.text: An cultist apostate - I reckon one of a kind. Curious.
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_9.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harper lowers blade while speaking.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_62.speaker: Player
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_62.text: I'm infected with their parasite, but I'm seeking a cure.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_68.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_68.text: Jaheira's godsend. Such strange company you keep.
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_68.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to player. Harper raises his blade and points at the player.NodeContext: Very suspicious

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_27.speaker: Player
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_27.text: I meant to infiltrate the cult. You've ruined the mission.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_64.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_64.text: Then I can only apologise. I was not aware of this mission.
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_64.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harper lowers blade while speaking.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_66.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_66.text: The lantern is yours - Jaheira's orders. Take it, and it will guide your way to the Towers.
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_66.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harper hands player the Moonlantern

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_18.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_18.text: The lantern is yours to keep - Jaheira's said as much. It will guide your way to the Towers.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_63.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_63.text: But remember: you don't just fight shadows. You fight what hides inside.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_49.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_49.text: Your mission is fiction, snake - and Harpers do not ally with liars. We silence them.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_13.speaker: Player
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_13.text: The cult took me prisoner. Thank the gods you came when you did.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_26.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_26.text: We've done only as duty dictates.
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_26.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harper lowers blade while speaking.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_31.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_31.text: You were no prisoner - and I am no fool. Your lies end here, rat.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_55.speaker: Player
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_55.text: I'm not here to explain myself - I just want the lantern. Hand it over, or die.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_21.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_21.text: Go on. Take the beast's lantern.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_17.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harper lifts lantern into the air. Its glow illuminates his face,

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_70.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_70.text: Incredible. A light so radiant, not even the curse can dim it.
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_70.context: CinematicNodeContext: Musing, not really said to player.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_24.speaker: Narrator
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_24.text: *The lantern flickers ever so briefly, and you hear a slight twitter - or perhaps it's simply your imagination.*
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_24.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera shows lantern in Harper's hand. The light flickers just a little, and you hear a little titter come from it. Harper stows the lantern.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_41.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_41.text: A pleasure to keep my weapon stayed for once. Go on, the lantern's yours.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_72.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_72.text: Extraordinary. You strike even truer than I'd expected.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_51.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_51.text: It's time you seize what's yours. Check the drider - take the lantern.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_75.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush_75.text: A tongue of pure silver. Take the lantern from the drider - you've earned it.

AD_EscortInterrupted_0.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_EscortInterrupted_0.text: Return to the light! Do not stray!
AD_EscortInterrupted_0.context: NodeContext: Drider notices the player has left the safety of the caravan and wandered off into dangerous ground

AD_EscortInterrupted_1.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_EscortInterrupted_1.text: Do the fools want to die in the dark, Majesty?
AD_EscortInterrupted_1.context: NodeContext: Drider notices the player has left the safety of the caravan and wandered off into dangerous ground

AD_EscortInterrupted_2.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_EscortInterrupted_2.text: Come back! They must stay in the light, Majesty.
AD_EscortInterrupted_2.context: NodeContext: Drider notices the player has left the safety of the caravan and wandered off into dangerous ground. First phrase is shouted into darkness, second line is delivered to his god, in his usual crazed fashion. Quieter on second phrase.

AD_EscortInterrupted_3.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_EscortInterrupted_3.text: They leave us again? Very well, my queen - we will wait.
AD_EscortInterrupted_3.context: NodeContext: Tiny bit resentfully. You're running out of patience

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_31.speaker: Kansif
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_31.text: We are ready when you are, True Soul. We need only the lyre.
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_31.context: NodeContext: Fixed smile and subservient - impatient but trying not to show it

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_35.speaker: Kansif
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_35.context: NodeContext: Bows their head slightly. This is their first time meeting a revered true soul

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_145.speaker: Kansif
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_145.text: Then pluck a tune and our guide will come scuttling.

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_1.speaker: Kansif
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_1.text: As the Absolute wills. We'll wait.

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_24.speaker: Brawler Vez
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_24.text: Ain't like we got much choice, is it?

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_12.speaker: Player
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_12.text: Forget the lyre - your guide will answer to a True Soul.

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_65.speaker: Player
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_65.text: Reach out with your powers to summon the guide.

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_141.speaker: Narrator
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_141.text: *A shiver runs across your mind... You feel sated.*

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_78.speaker: Narrator
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_78.text: *Something stirs deep within you, hungry and alert... it's taking something you'll never get back.*

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_136.speaker: Narrator
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_136.text: *Your mind lurches, reeling suddenly as if... bitten.*

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_28.speaker: Narrator
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_28.text: *A shadow swims across your vision, and a familiar voice tells you to be calm. You are loved.*

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_115.speaker: Narrator
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_115.text: *Your silent greeting hangs in the air a moment, unanswered. Then, from the dark...*

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_140.speaker: Kar'niss
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_140.text: Yes, I hear them, your majesty. Calling us.
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_140.context: CinematicNodeContext: A voice from the darknessNodeContext: A voice from the darkness

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_4.speaker: Lae'zel
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_4.text: The Weaver's servant. Abhorrent - and captivating.

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_119.speaker: Kansif
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_119.text: Greetings, in the Absolute's name. You have been charged with - guiding us...
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_119.context: NodeContext: Formal tone, addressing a respected member of his cult, but the creature isn't listening - it scuttles away to look at something else and he trails off

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_62.speaker: Kar'niss
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_62.text: New flesh for you, my queen. But, who are they?
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_62.context: CinematicNodeContext: The DRIDER ignores the Half-Orc and scuttles over to the player, leering down at them.NodeContext: The DRIDER ignores the Half-Orc and scuttles over to the player, leering down at them.

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_94.speaker: Kansif
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_94.text: ...Best introduce yourself. Perhaps he'll listen to a True Soul.
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_94.context: NodeContext: talking to the player - deflated because you were ignored by another NPC who prefers to talk to the player

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_111.speaker: Shadowheart
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_111.text: Gods - a drider. I always thought the stories were exaggerated...
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_111.context: NodeContext: a little horrified, a little awestruck

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_109.speaker: Karlach
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_109.text: Now that's what I call an abdomen.

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_138.speaker: Astarion
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_138.text: By the gods. One of Lolth's abominations.
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_138.context: NodeContext: Subtly taken aback - not quite horrified, but unnerved

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_18.speaker: Wyll
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_18.text: Watching gods... there is no boot big enough.

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_107.speaker: Gale
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_107.text: Someone pinch me, please. I'd really love to wake up from this nightmare.

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_132.speaker: Narrator
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_132.text: *Your blood runs quicker, feeding the gnawing absence at the centre of your mind.*

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_73.speaker: Narrator
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_73.text: *The presence deep in your mind is awake, unblinking. This is it. A single word pervades your consciousness: 'Soon'.*

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_63.speaker: Narrator
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_63.text: *Your mind is full, bursting with ecstasy and terror. Finally, it is coming. You are becoming.*

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_29.speaker: Kar'niss
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_29.text: I hear them, my Queen, but not your music. I await that sweet, sweet sound.
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_29.context: CinematicNodeContext: A voice from the darknessNodeContext: A voice from the darkness

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_61.speaker: Kar'niss
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_61.text: Yes. We will stay. We will wait.
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_61.context: CinematicNodeContext: A voice from the darknessNodeContext: A voice from the darkness

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_118.speaker: Kansif
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_118.text: Perhaps using the lyre would be the wisest course.
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_118.context: NodeContext: Gentling suggesting a correction to someone you respect. Stress on 'would'

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_39.speaker: Player
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_39.text: Take out the lyre and start to play.

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_42.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player starts to play a tune on the spider harp

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_83.speaker: Kar'niss
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_83.text: Yes, I hear them, your majesty. Calling us. Their god and their guide, together.
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_83.context: CinematicNodeContext: A voice from the darknessNodeContext: A voice from the darkness

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_88.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player plays a tune on the spider harp, poorly

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_85.speaker: Kar'niss
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_85.text: Your lyre, mistress! What are they doing to it?
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_85.context: CinematicNodeContext: A voice from the darknessNodeContext: A voice from the darkness - the drider hears you playing the harp badly

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_142.speaker: Player
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_142.text: Take out the lyre and start to play.

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_121.speaker: Kansif
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_121.text: Minthara always carried it on her person. I assume she still does.

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_139.speaker: Kansif
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_139.text: Just hurry back, we can't wait forever. The darkness is encroaching.

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_6.speaker: Player
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_6.text: I've other business to take care of first. Wait here.

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_64.speaker: Kansif
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_64.text: Of course, we await your pleasure.

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_92.speaker: Player
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_92.text: Reach out with your powers to summon the guide.

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_74.speaker: Narrator
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_74.text: *The mark glows, but you feel nothing in response. Your illithid power is beyond reach until you rest.*

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_103.speaker: Player
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_103.text: Reach out with your powers to summon the guide.

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_27.speaker: Player
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_27.text: Reach out with your powers to summon the guide.

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_10.speaker: Kansif
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_10.text: What do you suggest? I've never known him to respond to anything else.

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_80.speaker: Player
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_80.text: We've no need of magic strings. I will summon the guide myself.

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_89.speaker: Player
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_89.text: Open your mouth and ROAR - your anger a call. A summons.

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_44.speaker: Narrator
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_44.text: *Your rage echoes throughout the darkness - and it makes a connection. Something notices you.*

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_110.speaker: Narrator
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_110.text: *Your innate arcana roils and reaches - and it makes a connection. Something notices you.*

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_135.speaker: Narrator
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_135.text: *Your rage echoes throughout the darkness - and it makes a connection. Something notices you.*

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_49.speaker: Narrator
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_49.text: *Your music echoes through the darkness - and it makes a connection. Something notices you.*

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_75.speaker: Narrator
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_75.text: *Your power echoes through the darkness - and makes a connection. Something notices you.*

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_97.speaker: Player
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_97.text: Open your font of magic, let it pour forth as a beacon.

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_133.speaker: Player
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_133.text: Take your your instrument and play - your music a call. A summons.

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_7.speaker: Player
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_7.text: Connect to the divine spark within you. Channel it - your magic a call, a beacon.

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_32.speaker: Player
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_32.text: Channel the power of your oath, making it a call - a beacon.

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_16.speaker: Player
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_16.text: No need for the lyre. I'll call this guide myself.

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_147.speaker: Player
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_147.text: No need for the lyre. I'll call this guide myself.

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_41.speaker: Player
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_41.text: No need for the lyre. I'll summon the guide myself.

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_22.speaker: Player
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_22.text: No need for the lyre. I'll summon the guide myself.

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_66.speaker: Player
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_66.text: I'm not ready to summon the guide just yet.

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_17.speaker: Player
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_17.text: I have a lyre. It used to belong to a drow.

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_90.speaker: Kansif
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_90.text: Good, we were told to expect you.

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_96.speaker: Player
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_96.text: Why do you need a lyre, exactly?

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_102.speaker: Kansif
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_102.text: I admit, I'm surprised a True Soul does not know this. Where are you headed, exactly?

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_127.speaker: Player
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_127.text: True Souls don't answer stupid questions.

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_69.speaker: Kansif
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_69.text: Forgive me True Soul, we are simply eager to reach Moonrise as soon as we can.

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_48.speaker: Player
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_48.text: If you want a tune, I know plenty.

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_3.speaker: Kansif
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_3.text: Forgive me True Soul, but what we want is to get to Moonrise as quickly as we can.

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_93.speaker: Kansif
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_93.text: We were told to expect a True Soul - that Nightwarden Minthara would send someone with her lyre to summon a guide through the darkness.

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_20.speaker: Kansif
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_20.text: If the Nightwarden did not send you, who did? What are you doing here?

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_50.speaker: Player
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_50.text: This land is weak, primed to be preyed upon.

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_87.speaker: Player
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_87.text: I seek my old home - for that I must pass through to Baldur's Gate.

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_134.speaker: Player
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_134.text: I'm travelling to Moonrise, like you.

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_122.speaker: Kansif
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_122.text: I fear neither of us are travelling, then. The darkness here is murderous - the only safe way through is with a guide.

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_116.speaker: Kansif
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_116.text: You will not get far without a guide. The darkness here is murderous.

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_30.speaker: Kansif
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_30.text: Of course, you are free to take your chances if you wish. But I will be waiting here for the Nightwarden's lyre.

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_34.speaker: Player
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_34.text: I do have this lyre, if it's any help?

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_76.speaker: Player
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_76.text: And where can I find this lyre?

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_137.speaker: Player
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_137.text: I'm here to destroy the Absolute and every last cultist.

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_100.speaker: Kansif
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_100.text: The lyre, True Soul? It will summon our guide.
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_100.context: NodeContext: Now a little irritated and impatient, but maintaining a mask of civility.

AD_TollhouseFight_0.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_TollhouseFight_0.text: Pay no heed - onwards, to Moonrise!

HarperRanger_000_0.speaker: Harper Manus
HarperRanger_000_0.text: An honour to battle at your side. Jaheira is right to trust in you.

HarperRanger_000_1.speaker: Harper Manus
HarperRanger_000_1.text: I must be brief: if you intend to reach Moonrise, no torch nor blessing will fully guard you.

HarperRanger_000_3.speaker: Harper Manus
HarperRanger_000_3.text: Yet I know what can - a strange lantern, used by a cultist convoy that oft passes.

HarperRanger_000_10.speaker: Harper Manus
HarperRanger_000_10.text: Together, we will take it by force - you simply need speak the word.

HarperRanger_000_16.speaker: Player
HarperRanger_000_16.text: Let's take on that convoy. You lead, I follow.

HarperRanger_000_20.speaker: Harper Manus
HarperRanger_000_20.text: Quickly, then. I will mark your map, should we be separated.

HarperRanger_000_23.speaker: Player
HarperRanger_000_23.text: Go on ahead. I'll catch up.

HarperRanger_000_21.speaker: Harper Manus
HarperRanger_000_21.text: Very well. I will mark your map.

HarperRanger_000_5.speaker: Harper Manus
HarperRanger_000_5.text: But do not be long. Our chances grow thinner with each moment that passes.

HarperRanger_000_22.speaker: Player
HarperRanger_000_22.text: You're too late - I've encountered the convoy, led by a drider.

HarperRanger_000_9.speaker: Harper Manus
HarperRanger_000_9.text: Indeed? Then be grateful your head still sits atop your shoulders.

HarperRanger_000_2.speaker: Harper Manus
HarperRanger_000_2.text: The next step is yours alone to take. Make it a careful one.

HarperRanger_000_12.speaker: Harper Manus
HarperRanger_000_12.text: Then prepare. I will stand wait.

HarperRanger_000_4.speaker: Harper Manus
HarperRanger_000_4.text: You have other matters to pursue, surely.

HarperRanger_000_6.speaker: Harper Manus
HarperRanger_000_6.text: Keep on your toes. Cultists are on the move.

HarperRanger_000_7.speaker: Harper Manus
HarperRanger_000_7.text: The barrier's dropped. Find the light, and stick to it.

HarperRanger_000_8.speaker: Harper Manus
HarperRanger_000_8.text: Pardon, but I've no mind for small talk.

HarperRanger_000_11.speaker: Harper Manus
HarperRanger_000_11.text: Let the Moonlantern light your way, friend.

HarperRanger_000_17.speaker: Harper Manus
HarperRanger_000_17.text: Time to show us your might.

HarperRanger_000_19.speaker: Harper Manus
HarperRanger_000_19.text: Get to Moonrise, and get it done.

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_AtTower_0.speaker: Kansif
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_AtTower_0.text: It was an honour to walk the shadows at your side. A little more inviting here though, eh?
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_AtTower_0.context: NodeContext: formal, making a slight joke at the end

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_AtTower_1.speaker: Kansif
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_AtTower_1.text: Delivered, safe and sound. Don't forget us as you claw your way up the ranks, True Soul.
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_AtTower_1.context: NodeContext: Smiling, hopes to be rewarded for serving us so well

Caravan_GoblinMelee_001_AD_AtCheckpoint_.speaker: Warrior Gronag
Caravan_GoblinMelee_001_AD_AtCheckpoint_.context: NodeContext: Mumbled. Thought he heard something but quickly dismissed.

Caravan_GoblinMelee_001_AD_AtCheckpoint_.speaker: Warrior Gronag
Caravan_GoblinMelee_001_AD_AtCheckpoint_.text: Anyone else pops out unannounced, I'll feed 'em an arrow!
Caravan_GoblinMelee_001_AD_AtCheckpoint_.context: NodeContext: Growled into the darkness - he's walking the perimeter of his camp, a little jumpy

Caravan_GoblinMelee_001_AD_AtCheckpoint_.speaker: Warrior Gronag
Caravan_GoblinMelee_001_AD_AtCheckpoint_.context: NodeContext: Barked out at the edges of his camp. Thinks he hears something, irritated.

Caravan_GoblinMelee_001_AD_AtCheckpoint_.speaker: Warrior Gronag
Caravan_GoblinMelee_001_AD_AtCheckpoint_.text: That freak best be ready to guide us when it's time.

CINE_CaravanIntro_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player pauses as they hear nearby footfalls. They crouch down and observe.

CINE_CaravanIntro_1.speaker: Kar'niss
CINE_CaravanIntro_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player observes as the drider caravan moves into frame (wide shot).NodeContext: Urging the caravan along.

HarperCaster_000_AfterAmbush_0.speaker: Harper Elindale
HarperCaster_000_AfterAmbush_0.text: Not the cleanest of victories. But a victory, just the same.

HarperCaster_000_AfterAmbush_1.speaker: Harper Elindale
HarperCaster_000_AfterAmbush_1.text: Hold your nose and check that corpse. The lantern should still be on it.

HarperCaster_000_AfterAmbush_4.speaker: Harper Elindale
HarperCaster_000_AfterAmbush_4.text: A victory won with words is a victory all the same.

HarperCaster_000_AfterAmbush_5.speaker: Harper Elindale
HarperCaster_000_AfterAmbush_5.text: Check that drider. The lantern's still there, I reckon.

Caravan_AD_Hyena_2.speaker: Hyena
Caravan_AD_Hyena_2.context: NodeContext: Worg pup - sounds like a growl, but actually haltingly articulating a word (they can speak)

Caravan_AD_Hyena_0.speaker: Warrior Gronag
Caravan_AD_Hyena_0.text: Don't make eyes at me, you breech-blossom.
Caravan_AD_Hyena_0.context: NodeContext: Colourful goblin equivalent of 'shit-stain'. Said indignantly.

Caravan_AD_Hyena_3.speaker: Warrior Gronag
Caravan_AD_Hyena_3.text: You want a kickin'? Can only make you prettier.

Caravan_AD_Hyena_1.speaker: Warrior Gronag
Caravan_AD_Hyena_1.text: Should've let your mum eat ya.

AD_KillsSomeone_0.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_KillsSomeone_0.text: For the Absolute! For my queen!

AD_KillsSomeone_1.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_KillsSomeone_1.text: All will fall in Her name.

AD_KillsSomeone_2.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_KillsSomeone_2.text: We strike down the blasphemers in Your name, Majesty!

AD_KillsSomeone_3.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_KillsSomeone_3.text: We shall not fail! We shall stand victorious!

Caravan_AD_GoblinMelee_001_0.speaker: Warrior Gronag
Caravan_AD_GoblinMelee_001_0.text: I'll gut you in 'er name - for the Absolute!
Caravan_AD_GoblinMelee_001_0.context: NodeContext: 'er' here being a contraction of "her" (meaning the Absolute)

WaitingDuringEscort_4.speaker: Kar'niss
WaitingDuringEscort_4.text: Do not stray from the light, little one. The shadows are hungry.
WaitingDuringEscort_4.context: NodeContext: panicking a little, twitchy. Stopped momentarily in a dangerous region

WaitingDuringEscort_2.speaker: Kar'niss
WaitingDuringEscort_2.text: I do not lead. I follow Her voice - it calls us to Moonrise. Come!
WaitingDuringEscort_2.context: NodeContext: Religious certainty - the 'Her' is his god

WaitingDuringEscort_3.speaker: Kar'niss
WaitingDuringEscort_3.text: We must reach Moonrise - She waits there for us. Hurry, hurry, and be done with the darkness.
WaitingDuringEscort_3.context: NodeContext: concerned, anxious. 'She' is his god

WaitingDuringEscort_5.speaker: Kar'niss
WaitingDuringEscort_5.text: We thought you were lost. Such a shame it would be. Stay close!
WaitingDuringEscort_5.context: NodeContext: relieved to see the allies they're speaking to, having momentarily lost track of them in a dangerous region

AD_PlayerTakesMoonlantern_0.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_PlayerTakesMoonlantern_0.text: Return the lantern! You are not worthy to hold her light!

Harper_Melee_000_AD_TakesMoonlantern_0.speaker: Harper Branthos
Harper_Melee_000_AD_TakesMoonlantern_0.text: I have the lantern! Let's finish this up and go home.
